Case Title: Bacon has passed its expiry date
Case Description: Customer bought Farmer's Deli Rindless Streaky Bacon 200g which was on promotion for R55 if you buy 2 packs. She bought the bacon about 2 weeks or a week ago she cannot recall exactly. She cooked the bacon however claims it is very hard and the taste is very awful, they could not eat it at all. Asked if she sill has the package and asked her to confirm the expiry date.She confirmed the expiry date to be 22/12/2021. She indicated that she is only noticing that as she is providing it to me that the bacon has actually expired which should explain the bad quality. Asked her to check the other pack as they have not used it yet and she confirmed that it is 03/2022, she also mentioned that the colour of the bacon looks even better that the one which has expired.Asked her to send through images of the package, she said she will try however mentioned that she is not clued up with these things. She no longer has the till slip and has given permission to request it n her behalf on Xtra savings card number 9710 0840 9942 8431

Good afternoon
I often sit and have a cup of coffee or your special at the little coffee shop and have always enjoyed it.  The lady serving is lovely BUT.    Today it was terrible.   Only 3 tables available.   One that I could have had staff were sitting around, I asked if I could have that table please, as I am a pensioner and waited for another person to finish shopping.    This is becoming a staff canteen more and more.   On another table staff interviews were held, with staff shouting on top of their voices.  All the staff come in there to pay for their purchases and a big staff meeting and loud talking takes place everytime.  IT IS CERTAINLY NOT RELAXING ANY LONGER.  The security guard for sanitizing stands right in front of the coffee place and shouts at everyone walking past on top of his voice.    And to crown it all, the croissant we had was to oily and greezy it was TERRIBLE.   The lady behind the counter referred us to the not sure supervisor / F&B manager to complain to.  She had the loudest voice among all the staff.  We told her our unhappiness and she didn't even comment on it so I doubt she will not do anything about it.    That was my last visit to this little coffee shop, I will rather walk a bit further to The Merchant Coffee shop.  If this is a staff meeting place, interviewing, etc rather close if for the public.    Yours faithfully G DREWS

Good day, my apology for sending a complaint, I really do not like to complain, I find it tasteless and a bother to complain when there are so many who has really big worries.

This branch, however, is really a problem. There is no customer care - ziltch - from management to staff, they are all absolutely clueless and horribly lazy. From keeping loos clean and having basic soap and toilet paper to no knowledge or even availability of stock specials.

All of the above is being experienced by customers of Checkers Oudtshoorn.  The excuse from management, this is a small town, we can't expect city service and stock availability. Nonsense.

My husband went to Checkers on the 2nd of January 2022, with a print screen of the Checkers Specials catalogue marked 03/01/2022 - 23/01/22 - page 7 (I still have it on my phone). Note. Checkers Specials catalogue....... clearly noted on top in black.

He wanted to buy the condensed milk special of 2 cans for R40 (he would have taken 4 or 6 since I use it in a lot of recipes), but he was advised by staff that the special is only at Checkers Hyper. Unfortunately, or maybe fortunately, my husband is not someone who starts arguments or disagreements, so he left the matter and left the store, albeit disappointed.

But I have been showing him the difference between Checkers catalogues and Hyper catalogues, also pointing out the date.

Today he agreed we should share our experiences with you, although we do not like complaining or arguing or making an issue, I really have had it with this branch and their bad service. I know the standard of Checkers/Hyper and the standard expected from their staff, I know the pride Head Office has for the brand and I know the standard of service at this store is shoddy and far below acceptable level of service and retail.

This type of excuse is an ongoing issue, which is why I made a printscreen of the catalogue - this has happened a few times before with us, and as I understand from friends, with others as well.

I complain about this branch, not the brand, and I hope that something will be done to deal with it. If this branch is not performing on your books, this is why. If they are, I can assure you that someone is not relaying the true experience to you.

Again, thank you for being an amazing brand. My sincerest apologies that I do not have something really nice and uplifting to share with you, but I am sure that you realize that we do care about the brand which has prompted us to contact you.

May you all have a blessed day.

Kind Regards

Susan

The merchandiser responded by saying he will notify the relevant merchandiser and suggested the customer to take a pic on the basis that the customer mentioned she will be paying the price as per the PI Label in case it gets removed.When the customer got to the till the cashier called the manager for authorization as she indicated to her that asper the PI Label the peanut butter is supposed to be R1.99. Mr. Mabaso came and said he is not going to sell peanut butter for R1.99 and mentioned he will have to do his investigation. Customer indicated to him that she needs to go and fetch her son when he is done investigating he can give him a call. When they got there he asked the customer ï¿½in your right mind what makes you think the peanut butter can be R1.99ï¿½.  Customer questioned the statement and asked if the manager was saying he is crazy as it is not the manner to speak to customers and felt disrespected by the manager. He then asked the customer to point out the one she spoke to and the customer refused and saying this is not how to handle the matter, the merchandiser then spoke and indicated it was him that has asked the customer to take the picture. The manager started shouted at the merchandiser and when the customer told him that what he is doing is not necessary he then said it fine you are not getting the peanut butter for that amount if you do not want me to speak to them. At this point her friend was recording the incident, customer claims there was also another customer who wanted to buy 2 loaf of breads witnessing this as a result she ended up walking out of the store not buying the bread,   Customer indicated she will report the matter to Careline and the manager said the customer must go ahead, one customer commented and said ï¿½this manager is talking as if Careline do not do their jobï¿½. Store:Case DetailsCase Title: Re : Bad management @ Checkers BrackenhurstItem: {No Service Category} - {No Incident Category} - {No Object Category}Customer DetailsName: Mercia CorriganLandline: +27 743105101Cell Phone: +27 743105101Email: MerciaCorrigan2017@gmail.comAssigned To:Created On: 2022-01-11T16:01:27Status: OpenCase Notes:Technical User SAP_SMTP_IN 2022-01-11T16:01:27 UTCGreetings,I have had too many bad experiences at the Checkers here in Brackenhurst, Alberton.More specifically and recently on 26/12/2021 at approx 17:20  and today 11/01/2022 at 09:00am.I phoned there as well, after several phone calls and  after two days last week, spoke to someone called Leboma. This after I left several messages for a manager to call back.Quite a lot of issues are wrong at that store. Staff packing shelves, damaged boxes in your way, on the floor (today) dairy section, I even had to move it out the way. Staff are in groups chatting, you have to wait for them to finish conversations, especially at the tills, Empty shelves, nobody at the vegetable section to weigh and put a sticker on,  staff standing around chatting, no friendliness to customers, no greeting, conveyor area absolutely filthy, no wipe downs, they scream at you when asking if you want packets. They speak to friends and packers in their own language while you at the till, one even checking her nails, another adjusting her hair etc. No Covid rules there, no wiping, no spraying or sanitizing,  It is just  all round such a badly managed store. I frequent the one in Raslou, in Centurion where I live and everytime I come to Alberton, Brackendowns, I have to come to this one, as it is close to the house and  I do enjoy Checkers prices.  Seriously, you cannot communicate with management there, you can't speak to them on the phones, they don't answer for days, you get past  switchboard but they don't answer their phones in the office. Also, there is so much lack of discipline and customer care, it is quite shocking.  It would be better as an online store, as it seems that this is the way to go. Staff are mopping floors in the middle of the day and no care for customers trying to pass and hogging a whole aisle at a time. The vegetables especially tomatoes have "insects" flying around and the area is filthy, the stock is depleted. It has to be the worst Checkers I have ever been to and the levels have dropped to zero over the last year. You definately need a change of Management there. Suggestion of going undercover and experience what it is like to be a client. On these last occasions the store has been incredibly quite with very few customers. Sadly, there seems to be no care whatsoever for customers and staff really don't care.I trust you will look into this and would appreciate some feedback in this regard.Kind Regards,Mercia Corrigan--MerciaCorrigan2017@gmail.com    Cel no. 073 105 1014 / 066 219 3771Disclaimer:https://www.shopriteholdings.co.za/email-disclaimer.html

Dear sir,I tried to lodge this complaint on your website. The page simply does not work! POOR!When this store (Castle Gate) first opened I was quite impressed and started frequenting it regularly. I had never before been a Checkers customer.  I liked the product selection and store layout.Soon after the opening a very close friend of mine stated "he would never again go there"! He related a story to me that he was charged much more at the till than what had been advertised in the isles, and that it took him 45 minutes at the till to get it sorted and get his refund.This story stuck with me, but I kept going.Until this morning that is! Exactly the same happened to me. I popped in for some minor goodies I required and in the process bought two items which were advertised at the counter to be R55 if any 2 were selected. This is what I did.Remembering the story from my friend I did watch the price at the till, something I just never do, and true to form, the full undiscounted prices were rung up.I immediately queried the till slip and refused to pay. The cashier became annoyed and rude, but eventually - upon my insistence - called what I think was a supervisor. She then asked for the sign at the counter which was fetched and confirmed my story. By now I have been standing there for some 10 minutes.She tried rescanning etc etc and eventually started calling out for other staff. By then I had had enough and walked out.I proceeded to buy my goods at the local Pick and Pay which is what I shall be doing again from now onwards.This transaction may be small and trivial. I do spend on average R4 to R5000 per month on food and home-products. But this type of incorrect invoicing and behaviour is at best sloppy, unprofessional and simply wrong; at worst it is fraudulent. And this is the second such incident at this store since your opening in a very affluent area. It is criminal and whilst I could look the other way if this happened once, twice now is a trend and I will refuse to support you.You will simply never see me again in one of your stores, and yes - this story will be spread out by myself and my friend to the very many people we know!!!yoursChris Van der Sande+27 82 456 1390PS : this complaint screen on your web also does not work very well!

I bought a rolled pork belly roast on Sunday the 9th of January and while shopping found some crumbed chicken schnitzel with mould growing on them, which I removed from the shelf and brought it to a lady working in the butcheries attention. On opening the pork roast I had a nasty suprise, the product was off. The smell was definitely that of rotting meat (spoilage bacteria doing a good job!). I returned the product on Monday the 10th of January and received a refund (thank you). Following this a gentleman named Thabo contacted me and apologised profusely for the error. He then delivered a package to me today and gave me the assurance that the problem was being dealt with. I would like to say that I was very impressed with the way my complaint was handled especially by Thabo after a bit of a bumpy start. Thabo was very professional and eager to get the problem rectified. Please note that I do not complain in the hope of getting a reward, the reason why I complain is food safety should never be compromised, being a food safety specialist I understand the importance of a robust food safety system where errors can be identified and corrected. Things go wrong, I understand that, but what is important is what is going to be done to prevent a recurrence. 
Now onto my suggestions for improvement:
1. The 60sixty delivery staff should be wearing their masks correctly. At East Rand Retail they very rarely wear their masks while waiting for a delivery.
2. Do till Packers receive training on how to pack? I have on numerous occasions had to step in and help, I have cooler bags for perishables and when handing over my bags I always request for the perishables to be packed in the cooler bags to no avail. I always have to step in and help. I'd rather just pack my own groceries.
That's a very long story, but I hope that it is taken with the understanding that it comes from a good place, there is always place for improvement. I did say that I would never shop at Checkers East Rand Retail Park again, but may reconsider and I hope that of I do shop there again that I will see some (even small) improvement.
Regards,
Lou-Anne Wiese

On three occasion I have been sold fish that was off at this store. I let it slide the first and second time - which was some time last year.

Case Description:
Hi there, I was always a regular at the Blu Bird store, and was at the store when the great ll fall down system shut down happened a few years back. The service I got there was excellent - the staff was great and I was from then a Checkers convert!

Then a few months later I noticed that the regular management team was no longer there and was quite sad, I was regularly greeted by them in the store! And then no more.

Then I headed to the Rosebank store - what a pleasure of a shop - and imagine my great delight when I saw that the Dream team were there - Kevin and Jeffrey and all those amazing guys. I asked whether Kevin was working that day and lo and behold my checkers night in shining armor appeared - with the same smile and great service as always.

I just want to recommend this team, They faced a really tough challenge in Blu Bird - made it through with flying colors, and then took on the new challenge of the flagship store in Rosebank. And what a success. Everyone I speak to has the same positive feedback about that store, and the great team that runs it. 

So a massive round of applause and THANK YOU to the Rosebank team - they really do their brand proud and make it a pleasure to shop there.

This is totally unacceptable and to make matters worse one cannot buy the item online why is this????

How to place platter order

Good day, 

I have recently come across your Puddi Cat Pilchard Flavour soft cat food, which appears to be retailing at approximately R15.00 per tin. 

I have noticed that your stores carry very limited stock, and I am currently in a position where I personally deal with multiple feral cats, and ordinarily require in excess of 15 trays per month. So far, I have seen a liking toward this particular flavour, and am wondering if it is at all possible to make arrangements to do a bulk order of 18 trays per month at a suitable price catered to bulk buying. 

I am amenable to mix the order between Pilchard flavour and Chicken & Liver flavour. 

My proposal is to do it on an 'as and when' basis, so as to limit your overheads of carrying too much stock, which will allow a lead time between notification of order and ordering. Lead time considering.

Kindly revert back to me with your consideration as soon as reasonably possible.
TEL NUMBER & ADDRESS85371 - Checkers Ferndale

We bought a sandwich from Checkers Green Valley on Saturday.  The sandwich was not toasted properly and had loads of melted butter on the outside which was cold and not very appetizing. Dear Ms 


Please can we ask for help with next years school stationery for the children of Broederstroom?

We have only 68 children who can not afford stationery for the new school year and we will really appreciate it if you can help us to provide them with the necessary stationery.


Jeanine Harties Omgee current status is a Non-Profit Organization that assists the less fortunate:

ï¿½ School Feeding Program and we try to provide with all stationery at the beginning of the new year.

 ï¿½ Families & Children with a small income or no financial income at all.

 ï¿½ Elderly people with a small or no income / with no family or relatives.

 ï¿½ Families / Children / Personï¿½s in crisis with no food / clothing / shelter / medical supplies. The school feeding program provides food in the mornings before school, break times, as well as a food parcel to ensure that the children do not suffer any malnutrition and can perform a proper school day, as well as healthy learning ability. These children also received food parcelï¿½s for their families to ensure that is meals/food available at all times for the whole family that financially cannot afford the purchase of groceries, as well as ensuring that the families can survive without having the children removed from their parents due to the financial obstacles they face. We have a lot of families that either has a very small income that can only pay their rent, but not the basic groceries, or toiletries. The Hartebeespoort Community has a lot of elderly people that do not have any family or children that can assist with food or any basic medical care. Mostly bedridden elderly that are in need of healthy foods, proper medication, toiletries (nappies), as well as the basic items to ensure that there is a good hygiene aspect. Jeanine Harties Omgee relies on donations from the community itself, as well as sponsors that assist regularly with certain food items in bulk, or donationï¿½s made into the NPC bank account. Jeanine Harties Omgee assists with food, clothing, shoes, bedding, furniture (should we receive such donations) Medical supplies. All donations we receive, are well used and given back into our community to ensure the wellness of our children and their families, as well as our elderly.

 NB: WE CAN PROVIDE AN 18A TAX CERTIFICATE.


Kind regards

Jeanine

On the 31st of December 2021 I was a the Checkers branch in Horizon Village to buy a few items including 2kg chicken portions. I went to the fridge where they are kept and there was a promotional price displayed there (which I ignored because I do not have the Checkers rewards card) and the was also the small one similar to those that are displayed on the shelves. I took a packet aligned with a price label of R56.99 and when I went to the till to pay I was told that I had taken the wrong packet because it had scanned R118.00 at the till, to which I then asked that I be given the right one. A lady that was packing groceries for the casher (Nomathemba Koti) left to fetch it and came back with a packet similar to the one I had taken. She confirmed that there price displayed there was R56.99 and that there was no packet of chicken portions in that fridge. After asking the cashier if I could not be given the item in the price I had seen it she called a guy that had no name tag. We went to the fridge but the small price tag was not there and when I told him what had happened he started arguing with me. He then left to look for the manager, who was out of the shop at the time (I think I had to wait for him about 5 minutes). He came back and attended to me but he was of no help as well because he could not answer if I had to pay for the item at the price I had seen it for and he did not confirm my story with the lady that had gone there to check the right product for me. Even though I had said that I was in a hurry he wanted to argue with me  and I feel insulted as a customer because I feel like I am being treated like a crook. As a resident of Roodepoort West and an individual that works at Horizon village it is now uncomfortable going in the store as I feel like everyone watches me and talk about me behind my back (even though I had been in the store for about 3 times since the incident). My till slip number is #0346.

Good day, this is the second time I am having to complain about Checkers Kyalami Corner. I visited the store today at 9:30 am. At that time, it was chaos. My complaints:
1. The Sixty 60 shoppers all over the aisles, blocking access with their trolleys.

2. The aisles being cleaned at 9:44 am even though the store opens at 8 am. You are trying to shop navigating through other customers, cleaners, packers and 60-60 shoppers. Should the cleaning and packing not be done BEFORE the store opens?

3. Packers standing with shoes on the shelves packing. Is this not a health issue. How disrespectful to stand with filthy shoes where we buy our food. Who knows what goes on behind the scenes? Further, should staff not be provided with step ladders to reach high points in order to pack shelves. 

4. I could not get access to the foil/paper towels because it was blocked by crates of bread. Again shelves are being packed at around 10 am.

5. Only 3 cashiers at a busy period in the morning and 1 express cashier operating till points. Again, this makes social distancing impossible and creates long queues,

5. The behaviour of the tellers who are selective about which customers get treated properly. There is no greeting, please or thank you and I had to even pack my own groceries on my last visit because the cashier just sat at the till and ignored me. 

Itï¿½s disappointing that I have had to highlight these issues before and the manager has done nothing to rectify the situation.

Unfortunately I will now be forwarding this complaint to the health authorities because social distancing -in light of the pandemic-is not being enforced. Further standing on the shelves and filthy isles where foodstuff is packed is not acceptable and needs to be investigated.

In the last few weeks the quality of the product has deteriorated and many of the bottles are nearly flat and have very little fizz when opened. Grants. Donations
SAAMSTAAN PROJEK/STAND TOGETHER PROJECT is a registered NPC (None Profit Company).
The project is up and running for more than 24 months. The goal is to provide help to/assist the unemployed and homeless people in regaining their dignity improving on their quality of life making a better life for themselves, so as not to stay on the streets in shacks and under bridges.

We Currently provide accommodation in single and double rooms with running water, flushing toilets, electricity and 3 x meals per day for ï¿½ 40 people. This includes homeless, unemployed some elderly folks and children located on a small holding in Lusthof Pretoria approximately 25km North of Pretoria CBD in the Gauteng Province.

We have been fortunate enough to survive on own funds up to now, but as you are aware food and basic necessities is just getting more and more expensive daily.

Therefore we ask for assistance in helping us to assist the ones in desperate need and propel this very important course forward. Only with your assistance we will be able to prevent our people from ending up on the streets.

Any individual, firm or company that can see it fit and open their hearts to assist us in this very important and essential course; we're in need for donations of food, building material and cash donations .

At Saamstaan/Stand together we assist people in need, not only those whom recieve SASSA (South Africa Social Security Agency) grants, but we also help by taking people in who do not receive any type of pension or grant, therefore can not contribute towards their accommodation and food, hence stay and eat for free.

Any donations will be highly appreciated.

Thanking you in advance for your assistance.

(SAAMSTAAN/STAND TOGETHER IS A REGISTERED NPC (NONE PROFIT COMPANY) THEREFORE CAN ON REQUEST OF THE DONAR ISSUE A TAX RELIEVE CERTIFICATE)

Should you have any questions or need more information, please feel free to contact Willem on: 0825756952 or 0665859841
Email: saamstaanprojek@gmail.com

Dear Checkers Team,

At Tiqwa School, we seek to help special needs learners by creating an environment where they can learn to lead independent lives and better function in society.

While we have made some great strides, Tiqwa still has a lot to accomplish. 

Due to the negative impact of the Covid-19 pandemic, the number of learners at Tiqwa declined drastically over the past two years. Consequently, it is difficult to make ends meet every month, especially considering that we receive no government subsidy even though Tiqwa is registered with the Gauteng Department of Education. Nevertheless, we still make it our first priority to give each learner the hope of becoming a literate and independent person.

We need your support with the following: 
- Supplies for our cooking classes
- Cleaning products to keep our school clean and COVID-free, especially since our learners are high risk
- Stationary to enable our learners to do schoolwork

Would you consider donating goods or a voucher to help us achieve our mission?

If you have any questions, I would be happy to provide you with more information about how you can help support our work at Tiqwa School.

Please find attached to this email our Tiqwa Brochure for more information about our school and what our aspirations are with these special and precious learners.

We greatly appreciate your donation, and it will be used to realise our mission of ensuring that these learners make meaningful contributions to society, regardless of their limitations. 

Please join us! With your donation, weï¿½re one step closer to making a difference in the lives of our special learners!

Sincerely,
Christa van Tonder
Acting Principal
Tiqwa School

On Sunday 16/01/2022 I bought 2 racks of Pork ribs taken from the freezer, one was R92,00 and the other was R101,00. My partner made me aware of the fiwl smell on both racks of ribs but I dismissed her bcs I was so much craving for the ribs. When I got home I opened one rack and prepared the ribs myself, with mixed herbs and spices. I also smelt the fowl smell like they're off but hey I've got to tell you one thing, they were so tasty and juicy. I put the raw ones in the freezer but yesterday when I got to prepare them I realised that the fowl smell was actually real.I am so dissapointed to receive no value for my money esp from such a big brand like Checkers. Shopped at this store just after 8am on Tuesday 17 January I had my things and started to unpack the trolley. 
I greeted first then after Melicent scanned the groceries I then said to her Yes thank you I would take packets since she did not bother to ask, I asked for R50 Now this is when it went ALL THE WAY SOUTH FOR ME. Her answer was a simple NO she canï¿½t she does not have cash just coins. I said again I want to draw R50 then she proceeded to tell me she has only had 1 customer I cannot expect her to have cash. I asked for the manager she ignored the request I asked again and she said manager canï¿½t do anything for me if there is no cash in store. So I explained to her they have hugely written Money Market and she told me just because it says that does not mean they always have money. 
So I told her any shop that trades needs to have a certain amount for an early morning float. Now this is where I realised she had no idea what I was saying. I never got to see a manager but this VERY VERY INTELLIGENT cashier Found R50. After all that pure nonsense. I only want ONE QUESTION ANSWERED. Where are checkers cashiers trained. Never do I walk into a superstar or a Woolworths and get such utter vulgar rude service. Never. This is the only answer I seek so I can understand why every time I go into checkers I watch the only customer Melicent had before me was an African lady and she got a hullo she was asked if she needs packets and was treated like an African Queen. So either this cashier canï¿½t stand white people or I have offended her in her past life. I am slowly getting tired of walking into sunward checkers and being treated so horrible. Just put boards up by the cashiers who hate serving white people. Easy. 
Melicent was cashier 8.

Hello, I was going to shop at Checkers but my 7 year old boy needed to get a hair cut at the barber shop inside the mall. Thus, also having a 2 year old, I went into the store to grab a cart, since the carts outside were hot after seating under the sun the whole morning, and it would burn my toddler if I used it. I was immediately informed that I couldn't get the cart out of the store and that instead I needed to get one from the parking lot, which trust me, it was my first intention since my toddler is on the tallest and heaviest side of his percentil group. This happened at approximately 13:00 h and the mall is called Kalahari Mall for a reason. It gets extremely hot during summer. 

Now, I understand the reason for the rule, but not all weather types in South Africa are the same, and besides, I don't think it is sound advise to tell a customer that he/she needs to go grab a cart that has been under the Kalahari desert's sun the whole morning and part of the afternoon, so that his/her 2 year old gets burned while trying to some shopping. Especially, when there was no shortage of cars inside the store, and like I said, I had a toddler to sit on the car so that I could actually do some shopping.

Thus, I would appreciate if you could takie extreme weather situations and chlidren into consideration when enforcing some of these rules. If I have to go to Spar, or Game, or Woolworths to get a shoppong car, chances are I am getting my shopping done there, since Checkers happens to be at the opposite end of the Mall.

Kinds regards, Jaime.

Case Title: Bad and slow service as well as mold on our platters
Case Description: HI. I've ordered 2 platters on Wednesday (26/01/22) to pick up today (28/01/22) at 11:30. I arrived at 11:25 and asked if it is done. I was told they were still busy but could see that the lady was chatting in the background and having a laugh. After about 2 minutes she said I was early and told her she has about 3 min left as I have to leave otherwise I will be late for my next appointment. I could see that the second platter was only half way and told her she was going to be late whereby she screamed at me that she wouldn't. She continued to chat with someone else and I only got my platters at 11:40. I was only out of the shop by 11:50 with the queues. But this isn't even the worst part, only I arrived with the platters at my destination, did I see that 2 of the tapas had mold on them. (see attached pictures). This is completely unacceptable as it seems there is no quality control with your food. So not only did your employee have an attitude towards me when SHE was late with the order, but also that I got old moldy food.

Good morning. I missed your call previous today due to other commitments but thought I still need to give feedback on complaint ref 1363883.

I would just like to thank you for the quick and responsiveness on solving this issue. I would like to thank everyone that helped me including the manager of the Langehovenpark store as she made sure that my complaint was solved with immediate effect. She gave us a complimentary platter, as well as a gift card for the inconvenience. She went over and above of what was necessary and I can only praise her for that. 

I know we all sometimes slip up, but what matters is how you fix the issue and you guys did a wonderful job. Thank you again!

Case Title: Complaint: Poor Quality Farmers Deli Ham
Case Description: Last week we bought a whole lot of groceries for Christmas from our local Welkom Checkers (which is closest to us, as we live in the Doorn suburb) which included a pack of Farmer's Deli Sandwich Ham Sliced 180g.I used it for a Christmas Lunch Buffet Platter and to our greatest dismay found that almost every slice of Ham had chunks of "grissle" in it... this totally ruined our appetite as there's nothing worse than finding a bite full of grissle when you're trying to enjoy some meat.This is the first time we've had such a disappointment with cold meats as we've bought this product numerous times from Checkers.This is like getting the cheap off-cuts put together just to make extra and QUALITY should always ve placed above Quantity.Attached are photo's of the product as well as a photo of some of the grissle pieces found in the Ham slices. The Barcode as on the photo's is 6001224598667 and the BB & PD info was printed over the wordings " SERVING SUGGESTION..." so you can't really make out the Day or Time, however the month & year is visible if you zoom in on the photo -  BB ...01 2022   PD ...12 2021.We have now stopped buying this product because of this experience.Hoping this information suffices your investigation.

HelloI purchased a fresh chicken from the Checkers store in Woodlands, Bloemfontein on 10 January 2022It was only once I got home that I noticed the sell by date of 9 January 2022. I typically do not check the sell by date of every item that I purchase, and assume Checkers has a QA process in place to ensure fresh products past their sell by dates are not presented on the shelves for customers to purchase. Particularly in the case of a product such as fresh chicken, with the salmonella health risks associated with consuming expired chicken.I attached photos of the receipt and the packaging on the chicken, showing the sell by date (9 Jan), as well as the date of purchase (10 Jan). I still have the chicken, and will not eat it.I am an Engineer and am familiar with QA processes and food safety. I know under the FCD Act, it is a criminal offence to sell expired food. I have two young children, who have higher health risks associated with eating expired food. Had I not looked closely at the labelling, I would have prepared an expired chicken for their dinner.I am not expecting just a replacement chicken, considering the serious nature of stocking and selling expired fresh chicken on the shelves of one of your stores.Please note the details of the xtra savings card that was swiped with this purchase are different to my contact details provided here. Please contact me as per the details provided in this message.

Case Title: Glass piece in 1kg red speckled beans
Case Description:
On 4 January 2022, we purchased items on the 60 minute app from checkers cornubia, KZN.

One item included 1kg red speckled beans. I cleaned half on a white surface so that any tiny stones could be seen. Unfortunately, glass was not noticed on a white surface. My husband bit into a piece of glass. I then examined the uncooked beans on a darker surface and found glass traces. The glass piece resembles a glass filament, possibly from a light.

There were also concerns after the incident as I examined the packaging.  It states a product from south Africa/China. Really??? I guess this clearly came from china. 

But no joking matter, I'm grateful we found the glass before my 6 month pregnant daughter could have supper.

Good day
 I wish to lodge a product complaint.In Sept 2019 in purchased a Platinum 1.7lt cordless aluminium kettle (Item no.7489284) from Checkers Cornubia.During winter of 2020 I noticed a water leak underneath the kettle and returned the kettle to Checkers Cornubia which was exchanged for a new kettle of the same.
In Dec 2021 the kettle has started to leak at the bottom and this is a serious safety issue.
I agree that the warranty is 1 yr for product failure.But the issue that I need to raise is the kettle is aluminium based rust free and therefore should not leak at all even after many years of use.So the question is why the kettle which has no malfunction concerns leakconcerns.The supplier should therefore 
I am a pensioner with limited financial resources.Please can you advise if the kettle can be exchanged or replaced.

Dear Checkers,

I would like to bring to your attention a serious issue faced in recent times. Your Sixty60 agents that are rushing around the store filling their trolleys to meet an order within a certain time limit are becoming rude, ruthless and violent. I have had an agent hit me full on with her trolley with a speed whilst i was bending down to pick chillies. She hurt me and she didn't bother to say sorry, just that she did not see me. Last week i was shopping and the place was busy, i had these same agents moving our trolleys out the way whilst we picking stuff off the shelf which is very wrong, during covid times i do not want someone else touching my stuff. 
Further to that they asked an old lady to please move out their way because they were in a hurry and she was in their way. This is absolute bullshit to be exposed to as customers. if you offer a service then ensure it is not going to expose customers that wake up and come to the store. if this continues then you will lose customers and have medical bills to pay.

I wish to acknowledge the excellent service I often receive from the butchery staff at the Empangeni store.  
They are always willing to go that extra mile to meet my requests.  A special mention to Vusi who is always willing to slice my meat with a smile even if he has just cleaned his machines. 
Last week I met the butchery manager Bogani who was also as pleasant and helpful.  
Their dedication and hard work does not go unnoticed.  I truly appreciate the service and look forward to my next visit  to the butchery for my meat. The butchery section is also very neat and clean and the meat of good quality. 
Thank you. Keep up the good work.

Case Title: Complaint: Noise during late night deliveries
Case Description:
I have contacted the store Manger Mrs Pillay on a couple of occasions who assured me that late night deliveries were to be stopped. I am still experiencing noisy refrigerated trucks that hoot to gain entrance and exit, off loading is often very noisy with workers shouting instructions and pallets or similar thrown down with out a care to the surrounding residents at very late times arriving at as late as 22:00 and leaving at 23:30.
Our local councilor Tex Collins has been advised and he will also add his weight to this frustrating practice. Please sort this out and convey your intentions soonest.

I returned one pack of Checkers House Brand Ginger Biscuits at 14h30 on Monday 10/01/2022 because the biscuits in the packet were all broken (as were all the biscuits in two other packs) all of which were purchased from the Hillcrest store in mid December 2021. A young lady(Natalie) was unable to replace the three packets because of Checkers policy of needing to have cash slips. I explained that these had long been disposed of so she called her immediate senior Front Shop Manager, one Warren (Suda..something?)
This is where it rapidly went downhill with Warren then responding to an angry outburst on my part when I tossed the biscuit packet on to the front shop desk. He became very aggressive and loudly threatened to call in store security and view the CCTV footage  - this all happening in full view of other Checkers staff and customers in close proximity! 
I found Warren's response to my assertions totally uncalled for and certainly not in keeping with the Checker's claim to customer satisfaction.
Must my wife and I now shift our loyalties to Pick 'n Pay, Spar and Woolworths? Just say so and we will be history and very vocal in social media.

Thank you.

A.B. Fisher
9 Hathaway Village
21 Wishart Road
Hillcrest
KZN

I was at checkers South coast mall to buy few items including green tea to my surprise closemor was going for R27. 99 but when I got to the till it scammed R69. 99 the cashier called a supervisor Maka Bheh that what the cashier called her, not sure of her really name. said he won't give it to me with the price I saw because it was not the right price told me I need to go with him to check, when we got there they had packed the shelves differently so he said someone had put it there.

I felt so disrespected by  Deon Moonsamy, what upset me the most is that they could have explained to me the difference between the item I had and the label it was under  but no they decided to play me for a fool, and worst my time more then 30 minutes. Case Title: Complaint : The Menu - Classic Ready to Eat Meals
Case Description: About 4 months the customer bought pulled pork and gravy and vegetables . She enjoyed the meal so much that two months later she bought four more but she was so disappointed with the quality. The ingredients were good but the meals were overcooked and tasted horrible. The beef  red wine and gravy with vegetables was tough and stringy. The pork was overcooked and the chicken and mushroom pie was dry. Because the customer does not often pass by the store she bought all four to enjoy at a later stage. The customer no longer has the slips for the purchase but she felt that she had to bring this to someone's attention to prevent future disappointment. She will be sending pictures of the product packaging shortly.

ATT: CUSTOMER SERVICE

Dear Sir/Madam,

We used to be regular Pick and Pay customers until their public address system turned up so loud that one could not concentrate on shopping. Complaints to the manager fell on deaf ears so we changed to shopping at Checkers Watercrest. We were extremely pleased with our decision as our shopping experiences have been delightful. Until today! 
All of a sudden we might as well have been back at Pick and Pay as the announcements, music, and adverts  were so loud. One could not hear oneself think and making an informed decision became impossible. We complained in store but there was no response.
We have been shopping at Checkers for three years now and would hate to resort to shopping at Spar. Therefore we hope for a return to an atmosphere where the voice of reason prevails.

Sincerely.

Mrs. M. C. Duffy

Waterfall

Case Title: Complaint: Altercation -Verbally Assaulted by Fellow Shopper
Case Description: Received a call from Mr. J RobinsonAdvised he would like to lodge a very serious complaint regarding an altercation between himself (24 year old male), his mother, granny and two other male customers.The customer says his granny is elderly 66 years old, was shopping at CH Westville an hour ago and they were verbally assaulted by two other male customers.The customers was standing by the fruit and veg counter looking for proper lemons in the packs when another male customer came behind them very aggressively requested them to move as he also wanted to be there, the other granny customer advised they are busy and also doing their shopping and requested the other male customer to wait and also approached the male customer about the manner he had spoken, the male customer the told the granny to lose weight and insulted her by saying the granny is overweight, this started an altercation and a heated argument between the customer mother and granny and the other male customer. The granny then wanted to take video footage in which the woman claims the other male customer grabbed the phone from her hand and said no footage will be taken, this left the granny and her daughter and son traumatized.The customer claims that there were other customers watching them and staff members but no one came to help calm the situation, when they were trying to locate a manager in the heat of the moment there was no manager visible at one point and not one security in sight to diffuse the matter.After the heated argument the management arrived to the scene in the store and requested the customers (mother, granny and son) to please come to the managerï¿½s office to further discuss and address.The son and his grandmother were hysterical and trembling and was offered water by the regional.The other two males was then called to the office to apologize but her son chased them away as another heated argument came upon themThe customer says the other male customer then left the store and no details was captured of them, the police was not called.The customer then advised the manager was the regional Mumsy, advised that the Regional did not address this serious matter accordingly and they did not feel safe as the argument was very intense and the other male customers could have taken out a firearm or any weapon if they had one and it could have escalated with no staff member assisting in trying to calm it down, the customer says she feels very unsafe in the Checkers environment also mentioned that no one walked them to their car as they could have been attacked and will never shop at the store again, also mentions they are leaving the country in a weeks time and did not want to have anything against their name.The customer feels that this is racism and discrimation as they were two women (The customer mentions that the other male customer thought there were White in race however when they opened their mouth they noticed that they were not) The customer says that a security member was talking to the male customers in Zulu, which they felt was very discrimating and insulted.The customer says that she will be consulting her lawyers on Monday and shall also take this to the Media and shame the Checkers brand in not assisting in this situation, advised that management should know how to handle these types of matters which seemingly they donï¿½t and would like to bring this to the attention of the head office and requires feedback.

Case Description: Sadly, my excitement at having a well presented and stocked store close to home (Edgemead) has been shattered.I will not bother returning to the renovated and renamed Shoprite-to- Checkers-Store, in Bothasig.TWICE now, I have experienced you misrepresenting pricing in the store. The first time it was resolved, though your staff lied about the location of a champagne placed ï¿½specialsï¿½ ad.  Fortunately, other customers had also witnessed its placement.  So they had to rectify their error.Now, today:Your in store ads for Cadburys indicate two chocolates for R18.  Low and beholdï¿½ normal price is once again, rung up.  I asked for the  Manager and a lady asked me why.  I told her.  She then said  ï¿½you can wait here. Iï¿½m busy with another client.ï¿½ And then walked off.Right.That was actually your manager.  This is how she speaks to paying customers.  I do not object to being asked to wait,  I object being spoken at.  There was no reason why she couldnï¿½t say ï¿½Iï¿½m busy with another customer.  Please wait here and I will be with you, shortlyï¿½.  Clearly, manners arenï¿½t a requirement in order to represent your brand.I didn't even want a refund.  A few rands is not worth the paper work.  I merely wanted to point out, pricing discrepancies. Yet again.   I left the store after having explained the issue to another staff member, who had approached me to offer assistance. And Iï¿½d like to point out, that upon hearing the issue and that Iï¿½m not even wanting a refund:  I was graced with an eye roll.Your new store is sadly let down by your staff.  I will continue to pay Woolies prices and not have to scrutinise receipts, to ensure they arenï¿½t pulling fast ones over on me re. Specials that arenï¿½t rung up and whose staff wouldnï¿½t even think about treating clients like your staff do.  Last time I checked:  I donï¿½t have four legs and a tail.Your training is clearly abysmal and Iï¿½m happy to never return and to share this horrid experience with my family and friends.  No one deserves ï¿½customer serviceï¿½ of that low level. Or, the pricing discrepancy issues.

I was at Checkers Cape Gate Mall today, this is always a treat for me as I enjoy that specific shop. At the entrance was a big advertisement showing the special. It was about supper time and I thought this deal would be perfect. I ordered the deal but to my disappointment and after a few attempts by the lady at the food counter running to and fro to the manager, we were told that the special had ended on the 3rd January (the ad clearly states that the special runs until the 16th, I only noticed this when I arrived at home). A few other customers including myself walked away rather sad missing out on the deal. My gripe with Cape Gate Checkers is why on earth would they advertise the deal on a massive board right by the entrance, this is not fair to customers. I still bought a whole chicken for supper as I was famished. To top it off, the cashier at the till told me...'sir did you know if you buy a whole chicken you can get a free cooldrink.' I just smiled and told her that the special is finished.This incident will by no means stop me from shopping at Checkers in the future, however, I do feel I was done an injustice today with false advertising.Advertisement and Till slip attached.

I spent most of Thursday (27/01/2022) calling several checkers stores (about 10) in the northern suburbs of the WC to enquire about the availability of the 45cm Platinum Industrial Floor Fan. Many of the stores made me wait for many minutes (I waited for 8 - 10 minutes with Cape Gate Checkers. I called them back and they took my detail but never called me back). Checkers Hyper Brackenfell, Checkers Willowbridge, Checkers Durbanville, Checkers Okavango Crossing and Checkers Parow Centre indicated they had no stock immediately but several of the other branches were unhelpful and clueless. My actual complaint is that there are no 45cm Platinum Industrial fans to be found at any Checkers and no one can indicate when there will be stock again in the WC despite Checkers advertising the fans until 04 April 2022 (advert attached). The store personnel are unable to provide any information and merely indicate that it is time to receive winter stock now (heaters etc). In the WC we are yet to enter the peak of summer. I would appreciate it if someone could please indicate where I can purchase the 45cm Platinum Industrial Fan as a matter of urgency. Kind regards, Kim Jacobs

Yesterday (Monday 17 January) I took an empty honey jar with me to Checkers at the Constantia Emporium and decanted honey into it from one of the two containers provided. Next to the honey dispenser were empty jars, marked at R8.00. Prices were also indicated for various amounts of honey, ranging up to 1 kg. The signage indicated something to the effect that the total price would be calculated by the teller. When I presented the jar of honey to the teller, with the rest of my shopping, and explained that I had decanted the honey into my own jar, she summoned a senior staff member, who sent for an empty jar, which the teller scanned. I saw afterwards on the till slip (attached) that I had been charged for an empty jar (which I had not purchased) but NOT charged for the honey itself. The initial puzzlement of the staff members involved and the subsequent error suggest to me that they were completely unaware of the process required to charge for the honey. 

While I don't object to getting a free jar of honey, I am concerned and disappointed that teller staff (including a supervisor) could bungle a procedure that must have been operating at this branch for some time. (I first saw the honey dispenser a week ago, 10 January, so honey has been available in this form for at least that long.) Also, I sincerely hope that customers are not obliged to purchase your jars, because that would defeat the ecological and economic purpose of selling honey this way. I look forward to your explanation.

Dear Checkers online staff 
Just for the record I was astounded at the poor level of customer service I received at Checkers Constantia (New shopping centre) when I attempted to return 2 packets of Sunlight washing powder that had incorrectly been substituted for my request for BIOCLASSIC on Checkers 60 online . This product was chosen so as to be used for grey water. SUNLIGHT washing powder is NO substitute!!!!  
When approaching customer service explaining my need for exchange at about 2pm on Monday 17 January the 2 staff were totally disinterested , reluctant to touch my clean checkers 60 bag, and said they would and could do nothing without a printed slip . 
The Sunlight washing powder was clearly in perfect condition and untouched. I proceeded to spend over R2000 on my monthly shop and on finishing again requested a manager to help me. It was now 3pm .
None materialized!! Eventually after an unpleasant interchange, wherein the staff member at customer services ran away from being photographed, R78 was credited to my purchase and I left Checkers thoroughly disconcerted by the unpleasant shopping experience I had . Please let me know what you intend doing to improve customer relations?.  At this point I think I will remain at Woolworths where I am always treated with respect and a willing ear. Thanks Jeanine

Jeanine Beukes 
3 Berram Rd
Rondebosch, 7700

27 January 2022Good morningRE: purchasing a roast chicken from the hot counter that was off (bad smell) with subsequent stomach upsetYesterday at around after 13h00, I was in the Checkers Constantia store with my brother. He especially drovefrom the Woolworths in Constantia Village to the Checkers Emporium as he likes the peri-peri roast chicken(ready-to-eat from the hot counter). Nonetheless, when we left (to my parentsï¿½ home) immediately after buyingthe chicken, I informed him that the chicken smell seems unusual. I was put off by it even before he opened thebag. When he opened the bag, I was not convinced that peri peri spice (plus whatever other spices they use)should smell that way. I was sure the chicken was off. I said that I was not eating what smelt unappetising,although I had already eaten a tiny piece ï¿½ then opted to throw the rest away. My brother reluctantly convincedhimself itï¿½s the spice combination, and since he bought from Checkers before and was always happy with thechicken, he believed all will be well ï¿½ against his better judgement; moreso because he was hungry.Gavin (my brother) and both my parents ate from it. My mom also said she thought itï¿½s not a good tasting chicken.Around 4am this morning, my mom was very ill. She had stomach pain, diarrhoea and fever. Around the sametime, both my dad and brother had upset stomachs too. My mom felt the worse as she had more severesymptoms.Thankfully they are all OK now. I presented with milder symptoms a few hours later because I had eaten thesmallest piece. I donï¿½t live there so this is the only food item we all had shared (although in different quantities).I realise that you will question about whether it was the chicken as technically there is no proof. I know it wasthe chicken. The smell was odd, and will choose to never buy chicken at Checkers again.Further, that my family all presented with similar symptoms at around the same time alluded to the incubationtime of the bacteria from the time they all ate together to onset of symptoms. I am a food microbiologist withexpertise in food-borne pathogens and its association with clinical disease. The reason for my email is forawareness only. Yes, it may be an isolated incidence but surely there must be quality control from the time rawchicken (within expiry) is roasted, to the monitoring of temperature and conditions for ensuring quality andsafety during storage. I let you know so that no one else has to experience the same and to ensure that otherready-to-eat chickens are of good quality and safety.Regards,Dr Diane Rip

Dear Fair Cape,As a loyal Checkers New Concept Store customer who enjoys and supports your dairy products I feel compelled to bring the following matter to your attention:I recently purchased a 500ml Vanilla Flavoured custard from Checkers at the new Drakenstein Centre, Paarl. My wife required it for a recipe which required 500ml custard. After pouring the contents into a measuring jug it became evident that the indicated volume on your container measured out to be a just a touch over 350ml.I subsequently rinsed out the container and had to fill it with water to the point of overflowing in order to measure 500ml of liquid.Although I can understand that in all likelihood your production process does not allow you to fill containers to the brim, I must hasten to add that as a consumer I purchased 500ml of custard and NOT a 500ml container. The fact that the container is unable to accomodate what you say it does should not be the consumerï¿½s problem.To simply short change your consumers with 30 percent less than what your label claims is nothing less than disingenuous. A 150ml discrepancy in content is unacceptable. If youï¿½re selling 350ml of custard then it should state exactly that on your label.I have no desire to pursue the matter further in this instance, however I suggest that you own up to the fact that your company is misleading the public and make use of the opportunity to correct the matter.To Checkers, I trust that you will address the matter accordingly and revert.Yours SincerelyClyde Marais | 071 030 2273Paarl

I would like to inform regarding the bad service me and my partner has gotten.Since discovering there is a checkers in Sitari ive been going to this checkers. I live in strand and in my area we have two checkers but i choose not to go to those but to the store by Sitari Village. When first attending this store i fell inlove with everything, customer service was outstanding so i make it my duty to shop by sitari but today was the worst experience ever. While doing our shopping for new years, i told my partner that id stick him for a double hot chocolate just before we leave to pay for our Eatables/snacks we bought i went to the coffee kiosk, there was another guest standing there waiting to be assisted but there was no one. Staff walked pass not willing to assist or get someone to assist. Maybe it was not their section to work in im not sure but assistance would of been appreciated. My partner had to call the cleaner and ask her to call someone to assist, this girl comes scolding, irritated  that she has to assist, she assist the guest infront of us and then calls to us do we need help.I asked her for two double hot chocolate she says to me i have to make double and gets irritated, i told her there is two options on the board, single for R20 and double for R25, i told her its not necessary to be rude. She says to me that she is not rude and that she told me that it is double. Im a store manager and instead of getting defensive she should of apologized and make me understand where she is coming from.I went to the managers office there was no one, a lady which im guessing is manager walks pass, i said to her excuse me is there someone i could speak to she gives me the finger and says to me that i should wait she is busy with the customers thats with her i said its ok. She then came back to me and asked how she could assist me, i requested a email for head office complaints department she said she doesnt know it. She called a colleague from another store he told her that she should inform me regarding the TOLL free number on my loyalty card. I contacted the number and asked for the email. I explained to her that the cashier at the kiosk is disrespectful. The cashier name is Genevieve. When giving our order she only gave one double hot chocolate i then asked her where the other one is she said do i want another one. I then told her that this is what i was trying to explain to her in the beginning.I would like this matter to be dealt with.This is unacceptable. They are ambassador for the company, being disrespectful puts a bad name against checkers.People will not be saying the cashier was disrespectful but instead the cashier at CHECKERS was disrespectful.This affects businesses and it will travel by mouth.

On 31 December 2021 i was rudely ill-treated by a staff member.I was insulted i was screamed over.I did speak to the manager on duty at the time,but really feel that my shopping experience was made so bitter,it was so upsetting and feel that head office should be notified of the staff member that is a money counter clerk interfering in my sale at the the till point.I still can't believe i the treatment.

Hi, I am really disappointed in the quality of your cashiers as they are always very slow, but not just that.

Friday 28 January I had to buy a few things including airtime and data for my dad. There was a girl helping us and then all of a sudden a guy took over. When it came to buying airtime and data, my wife said that he looked like he didn't know what he was doing.

When we got home we just couldn't manage to load the airtime or the data, so my dad went to mtn to get help, and it turned out that the guy who helped us put the airtime on as Vodacom and not MTN.

I would not make a mistake of asking for Vodacom as I am not a Vodacom subscriber, Cell C perhaps since that is my network, but he gave us Vodacom and not MTN.

I am really disappointed since we wasted almost R100 to buy him airtime, so I would like to request that you actually train your cashiers and other employees to actually work fast and not get these things wrong.

As for the airtime mistake, I demand a refund. I don't care how you do it, but make sure we get refunded.

Thanks

I was at Checkers Kenilworth Centre today where there was an individuals in the 10 items of less queue with more than 10 items.  I informed the customer that she was in the incorrect queue and she ignored me.  I stopped a female staff member in a managerial shirt and told her this was the case and she didn't even look at me.  Just stated that the person would not be assisted at the till.I stopped a Trainee Manager by the name of Qiyam who also refused to tell the customer to leave the queue as she was over the limit.  I asked for a manager to be called when the woman was indeed assisted with her items regardless of being over the limit.  I told Qiyam that his reason for not wanting to address the issue was because the customer in question was an older Muslim woman.  Please note that I myself am Muslim and stated to him that it was wrong what was happening.When I informed the cashier (no name tag) that the customer had more than 10 items, the customer in question then pointed out another gentleman who was also over the limit so why cant they help her.  Please note the gentleman in question was over the 10 items limit, but was friendly with someone in a checkers uniform named Steven and he too was helped instead of being shown to the correct queue.No manager appeared even though I had requested to speak to one.  I was 2 customers behind the woman in question and yet I left the store before she was done being served.I do not see the point of having an express till when your staff are unwilling to even attempt to address people who are in the queue clearly over the limit of items.This was an unacceptable experience and the clear lack of management at the store was shocking.

Today whilst shopping at Checkers Kenilworth centre, I lost my bank cards when I dug into my bag to answer my phone. I only realised it was gone when I had to pay the cashier. I went into a panic . I immediately phoned my bank to block/ cancel my cards. Luckily my daughter was with me and paid for my purchase. While I was standing by the exit of Checkers thinking what must I do now, my phone rang. The lady said she's calling from Tymebank. I was a bit annoyed thinking I don't need sales calls right now. But she was really calling to inform me that my bank cards was handed in to Security at Checkers Kenilworth. She said I must either go to the Cash office there or ask for Qiyam. I was ecstatic. ?? I rushed to the customer service counter and asked for this Qiyam and said I'm coming to claim my bank cards. In no time the manager called him and while I waited for him a security lady came over to me. She asked me if I was coming to claim my lost bank cards. I said yes. She asked me to confirm how many cards was in my card holder. I named them. She smiled and said yes they do have it, a customer handed it in to them. I want to thank Security, Qiyam who called Tymebank and Checkers management and most of all the person who handed in my lost cards!!?????? Thank you Soooo muchBest regardsFrancesca MisrolePlaatjies0838968757

Case Title: Complaint - Checkers Housebrand Lemon Dishwashing Liquid 750
Case Description: Customer bought Checkers Housebrand Lemon Dishwashing Liquid. She returned it to store today. She is very unhappy with the product because she says it has a very strong toxic, chemical like smell to it. This smell has seeped into her containers, her dishes and her food. She states that she has had to throw away a lot of food, and Tupperware due to her not getting the smell out. She says the smell is sitting all over house. It's sitting in her sinuses, and it is all she can smell. She wants to know if we can advise on what to use to clean the household items as she has tried everything to get the smell out.She says herself and her son has been drinking activated charcoal and flushing their sinuses as a result. I advised her to seek medical attention if she sees fit to do so.The customer returned the product to store without noting the batch details. She does not have much images as one cannot capture the scent in a photo. I advised customer I will ask store to send images of batch details and I will then refer to buyer for further advice.

Regards.

I went this morning to the checkers at kloof and the service I received is absolutely pathetic. I got a few items, went to the cashier and asked her if she could please help me out with change, 5 rand coins to be exact, so that I may be able to do my washing in my apartment building. At first she says she doesn't have enough in her till, I understand and explain to her that I've done this before and they get the change from the front till operator who is nontwaza is this case. Cashier calls the the front till operator who immediately starts shouting and saying that I've been here yesterday asking for the same thing, I informed her that I have not as I just got back from Johannesburg and my Google timeliness will prove it, she then states that maybe it was my brother ? So I say to her that is completely wrong as racial profiling of ethnic groups is unlawful and I inform her I will put this on social media and show how racist checkers workers are for comparing everyone from an ethnic group to be the same. I am not happy. Something has to be done about this front till operator or I will send this video to many south African news agencies and publications as well as post it on social media on my account which has 50k followers to show how ridiculous this is. I treated everyone with respect in that store to be treated like this... absolutely pathetic.

She customer added that she was talking in Xhosa to her. The customer is unhappy with the bad service she received from the cashier. Message from the customer: Gistermiddag was ek biter upset. My trollie het ingehad 2 x 6 rolletjies 1 x pak bacon 3 x brode 3 x stringe Big Corn Bites 2 x pakke marsmallows Toe ek aankom in die so called EXPRESS lyn, was die dames op Till 4 (nie haar naam gekry nie, maar sy het lashes wat bo normaal lank is met goud en silver en blou oog skadu lyne ) en 6 (Seseko) regtig arrogan met my. Ek het gehoor hoe hle sit en Xhosa praar - SOOS HLE ACTUALLY ALTYD DOEN EN LAG !!!!! - ek het deurgestap toe dit my beurt was na Till 4 - en sy het my gewys "go there" en ek verstaan toe ek moet in Till 6 gaan staan en ek was nog nie eens voor haar nie, toe word en aangeval omdat my waentjie meer as 10 items het! Ek het nie mooi verstaan nie, en vra toe weer waarop sy my hard antwoord dat 'I can see you have more than 10 items - you must go that side) waarop ek haar gevra het of sy my goed getel het dat sy sulke aanmerkings kan maak!!!! Ek pak toe my goed uit - en dan is dit mos net "BAG?" nie middag of niks! Los toe eers die 2 x marsmallows - en vra haar so, how many items does your till show you? Nine - al antwoord wat ek kry ! Ek het haar gevra of ek maar die marsmallow moet los - en sy druk dit toe ook deur! Ek het dit ook aan die bestuurderes genoem, maar ek was ERG ERG teleurgesteld en regtig upset! Dit was ongevraagd, ombeskof en net totaal onnodig, want hle 3tjies op Till 4, 5, 6 het lekker TERWYL EK VOOR TILL 6 STAAN net aangechat in Xhosa So, net omdat my trollie 'vol' gelyk het met 3 x stringe chippies wat 5 elk aanhet (of tel elke pakkie chips as 1 item!!!) het HULLE besluit my goed is meer as 10!!!! Dit was onaanvaarbaar!!!!!!!! Ek het nog my strokie as bewys van aankope wat wys daar was net 11 items (nadat sy die OK gegee het om my marsmallows by te sit). Dis goed soos dit wat my oorweging om die winkel wat gerieflik is, te side step en verder weg te ry en my goed op ander plekke te gaan kry.

I support Checkers fully by buying my weekly groceries ï¿½R2,300 from the Gordon Rd store.  There is an ongoing problem where packers run away when they see a full trolley.  I reported this to the store manager last week which spoiled me with a bunch of flowers to apologize.  The problem persists though. I see the following when visiting stores:  Woolworths cashiers pack their own bags and do an excellent job.  Pick a Pay employ enough packers.  Checkers packers might as well be sacked and teach the cashiers to pack.  I always help packing as soon as my trolley is empty.  No sweat.  The problem is the attitude of the packers though. They also make a humungous mess of the packing, throwing bags with fruit in it and packing soft veg at the bottom with hard fruit at the top.

The service at this branch is very poor. Staff are clearly not trained, and have no idea how to interact with a customer. 
When I ask for assistance, the person either grunts, tosses his or her head back with an 'uhh', or walks away. 
I see staff checking their phones, hugging each other, having group conversations etc... but there is rarely anyone at the deli counter. I spoke to the manager about the above, but things haven't changed.
Today, early, there were far more staff than customers, yet counters were unstaffed. Why do you need hundreds of staff at one branch? It's ludicrous. Half of them are are doing nothing, except having a a great social time, and are of no use to the customer. All those excess staff just push up prices.
Someone needs to do an assessment of management and staff productivity at that branch.

Case Title: Eating in the store- Hygiene Complain
Case Description: While standing in the queue at the kiosk at Checkers Bayside Mall yesterday around 11 am there was an arrogant dude, mask hanging around his neck in front of me. He was leaning against the counter, obviously making himself more comfortable, while eating the sandwiches he was waiting to pay for. I felt the need to distance myself from this idiot who has no regard for anyone or compliance with current Covid regulations. This is not the first time I have come across people eating in store. A few weeks ago there were two ladies walking down the various aisles, eating pies which they hadn't yet paid for. Surely you could protect your staff and your customers from these transgressors by putting up signs "No eating in store" and also taking action against those who do. On both occasions these people were simply ignored by staff. If I ever see this again I will walk out without whatever I came for and never come back. Thank you in advance for taking some kind of action.

Case Title: Bad experience at Checkers in Bayside Mall (Procedure that i
Case Description: Good dayI would like to complain about the service I received at Checkers in Bayside Mall, firstly I stood in the line close to 20 minutes at the money market where as there was literally no line in front of me but people at the counter, there was no sense of urgency, secondly when I arrive at the money market counter asking for a cash back of R2000 and explaining that I will be transferring the same amount of R2010 using their services (which means I don't need the money in the hand) I was told that cash backs are not done at the money market which I did not understand why reason being I have used these services for years in the other different branches and I have never gotten this kind of issue not being allowed to do cash back at the money market it was the first at this branch, and then I asked for the manger to me called for me to explain why? Because this doesn't make sense and I so it Everytime in the other different branches and I have never had any issues or was never told about this, the Admin manager by the name of Thabile came after a few minutes which I assume they first discussed the matter before coming to me and she already had made her decision that she will stick to what they saying, without even considering to try and make the customer happy (even if it's a procedure put, help the customer and educate the customer about the procedure) but instead to chose to continue and tell me that she is not allowed even though I explained that I have done it multiple times in other branches and she couldn't explain why she was unable to do as I had requested the answer was just " it's procedure" I should ask the head office why, I asked for the customer complaint email and phone number so that I could raise my concerns about this, she chose to give me the email address of the store instead of the customer complaint line ( which I found very much disrespectful and underestimating my intelligence and looking at me as Stupid) hence that is why I have included the store email in this complaint to also show her Thabile(Admin manager) that I'm not stupid she should never again do what she did, when a customer asks for a complaint platform she should issue the customer as she had requested because when a customer complaints it actually gives you the opportunity to fix your wrongs, but when they keep quiet even if they not happy, they will walk away and not come back which means loss of business, I never thought I would have to explain that to a manager which I expected to know better then her cashiers, the same when procedures do not allow you to do something you should make the customer happy by doing it if it does not impact the business negatively then educate the customer for next time ( some customer service education for Thabile for next time).Otherwise I am deeply disappointed by the service I received in this branch today and deeply deeply disappointed in the way the manager Thabile handled the situation, but I hope this email will reach the right hands and all this will be I live and work in Paarl. Conveniently Chcekers Van Der Lingen is within walking distance from the offices where I work. Needless to say I shop there on a weekly basis. I used to love the shop, but in the last two years the way things are done is quite questionable.

I would like to point out a few factors that are quite concerning. On three different occasions I've seen mice at the bread section - running around on the bread shelves. On one occasion I saw a rat run form the Deli to the fridges where the cheeses are stocked.

On one occasion in the past i bought cocktail sized pies from the bakery. There weren't any fillings in it.

Yesterday I bought a tray of chicken fillets, but I had to return it because of a bed smell, and the fillets had a tinge of green to it.

When in store for my return, three other customers returned chicken bought from the deli.

This is not the Checkers Van der Lingen I've grown accustomed to.

Is there still such a thing as random inspection?

I don't think Checkers Van der Lingen is on standard  concerning service delivery. I am a loyal customer as many others. I think we could agree that things are generally expensive in the times that we live in.

I know that retail is highly target driven, but service delivery should be on the same standard shouldn't it?

Kind regards,
Suritha Sawall

To Whom It May concern

I hope that you are doing well and staying safe during this trying time that we are in. 

My name is Faika Abrahams, and I am the chairman of registered non-profit organization based in the heart of Athlone, we are known as the Sunflower Community Outreach. 

We have been doing everything in our power since 2018 to make sure that the underprivileged people in the community, children and seniors have a plate of food and are able to experience things that they may have never been able to experience before. 
We have begun planning our cooking schedule for 2022 and have come to the realization that we may not be able to cook everyday as planned due to a lack of sponsors. 

We have recently opened our own little library where the children in the area are allowed to come and collect books and keep them for a certain amount of time, as schools have returned back to normal, we would also like to hand out sandwiches on these days. 

With that being said, I would like to appeal to your company for the donation of any food ingredients towards pots of food for the seniors and underprivileged people and children within and outside of the community, these donations can be anything from vegetables to tin goods, every little bit helps. 

We hope that you will consider assisting us in providing our seniors and underprivileged people and children with a plate of food or even a sandwich at least thrice a week. 

Yours in the true spirit of Ubuntu
Regards 
Faika Abrahams
(Chairman/Director)
