Hello. Please pass this on to the relevant department. I want to stay anonymous, for obvious reasons. I'm a woman of 2 kids and a husband living in the edenvale area. 2 years ago, my husband And I both lost our jobs due to Covid and we basically fell into hard times. It was so bad that we had to sell almost everything we worked our entire lives for. I'm a very proud person but my last hope was just to send a message on Facebook to ask for help. You won't believe me, but in a matter of minutes a lady by the name of Janine, who works for a NGO called compass, messaged me and asked me what I needed. The very same day I met her at her shelter, and she gave me so much food which she received from checkers. Not only that, she also replaced almost everything in my house that we had to sell, like appliances, as well as my husband's tools, and much more. And on top of that, her husband came to our house with all these things and set up everything without us lifting a finger. I was so shocked and amazed at what these 2 people have done that I wanted to find out more about compass and them. Talking to some the people that they house, I found out that these 2 people work 7days a week, till late at night, doing things for the community. The day that I came to see the ladies in the shelter, Janine's husband was going through all the things that checkers has donated. He was sitting in that hot garage for hours cleaning and fixing things, so that they could sell it to buy an oxygen machine for another lady who was seriously sick from Covid and the hospital's couldn't do anything for her. And Ive heard so many stories of the good Janine(compass) has done. So when I decided to pop in to say hi, I found out that checkers was not sending their non foods to her anymore, due to someone making a complaint. It honestly hurt me, to find that a few individuals who only have the needy  peoples interest at heart has been cut off like this. I'm a good example of what Janine has done, I've witnessed the dedication from her an her husband, tirelessly working to help those who have just hit rock bottom, and checkers, eventhough a silent helper, also responsible for saving so many people's lives. You don't know the good things that have been done with the stuff received from you. I mean, compass is based in edenvale, but their reach of goodness is all over the place, Durban, Cape town, all over Joburg. And if you think that they are benefitting themselves  from all the stuff you were sending, you are so wrong. And now that they not receiving things anymore, I could see the worry on her face of what and how they can help people now. You need to send someone to come and find out for yourself the amazing work that Janine and her husband,with the helping hand of a few others are doing.

I need this message to be escalated to the CEO or Senior Management because a normal Customer Care employee does not necessarily have control over decisions taken on executive levels,  We are clients of checkers for many years and we love your shops and products, therefore the complaint is not about that.

My complaint is about the service Walk in Clients experience since the implementation of Sixty60.

We have now experienced this in the following branches and I can ensure you that this is probably happening all over : Queenswood Pretoria, Ecopark Pretoria, Checkers Hyper - Centurion and Checkers Hartbeespoort.
The staff that collects the orders as they received the online order (Sixty60) does not care how they push into or bump Walk in clients in the process.  
I do understand that you have a mandate to live up to with regards to the service you promise via Sicty60, but it should not at to the cost of your Walk in client base.
I do understand that you have a mandate to live up to wrt the service you render via Sicty60, but it should not be to the cost of your walk in client base.
If this continue,  you will definitely loose  your Walk in Clients.

I trust that that matter will be discussed at the executive level and that I can at least expect some feedback.

Regard
Charmain Pretorius

I bought 3 self adhesive covers and forgot to buy a plastic bag to go with. On my way out I stopped by the till closest to the entrance to purchase one. At first, the lady refused to sell the plastic bag to me. When I asked why she said I had to buy something first. I told her that I had infact bought three self-adhesive covers that needed packaging. She argued that I hadn't. I directed her attention to my son who was standing just outside the shop. She shook her head in response. I was getting frustrated at this point. I called my son to come over. I told her these are the covers, I need to buy a plastic bag for them. She went on to tell me not to be rude. That is when I just couldn't take her attitude towards me. I asked her if it made sense to her that I would drag my family to Checkers to buy a plastic bag. I pointed out to her that she was being rude to me. She told me that she wasn't and I was rude. I mean. How was I rude in the process? Twice I showed her the goods bought from the store, but that seemed to make little difference to her. She eventually sold a bag to my wife. A simple process ended up being frustrating and an embarrassment in front of my kids whom I teach to be courteous to shop assistants.

Dear Kishore Beejay

Yesterday (Tuesday 25 January 2022) I brought in a bottle of Harvest Table Marine Collagen for a return or exchange. As I mentioned to you yesterday the above product caused me to have diarrhea, vomiting and deep stomach pain. Furthermore, after having experienced these symptoms I researched the product and found no clinical trials were done to check it's safety for human consumption. Considering that this product is a health risk I asked you for a return or exchange of the product. You promised to contact Head Office regarding this and to contact me today it is now 13.30 and I have still not heard from you. As a pensioner with osteoarthritis I invested a lot of money in this product and as a regular customer at Checkers who does my monthly shopping with you, surely I deserve consideration? If I do not hear from you regarding this return or exchange, you will leave me with no option but to take the matter up on social media and with the consumer watch.

Regards
Dave Williams

Good day, my phone got stolen in the Fruit and Veg section of your Checkers Hyper Brackenfell store on 9 January 2022. We notified the security at the store when it happened, but they couldn't see anything because the camera did not work in this section. I just wanted to report this to you, so that it can be fixed, and potentially help someone else should it happen in the future.

I had recently received a virtual shopping voucher from Panel Station, a survey company that rewards you for completing surveys. I had finally received the opportunity to redeem my rewards, hence the virtual shopping voucher I received. They do not disclose the amount that you receive, only the points you wanted to redeem. So on the 30 December 2021 at 17:30pm, I took the voucher to Checkers so that I could buy my baby's soap & aqueous cream. When I got to the store, I immediately queued at the money market counter to have the virtual voucher exchanged. I told the lady at the counter, she took my phone which had the voucher details,then did something on the computer and told me the voucher is worth R4000. I was extremely happy & shared my experience with them. I even told them I'll refer them to the survey company, cz it's definately worth the time & effort completing their surveys. The lady gave me the gift card & I then collected a trolley to shop all the necessary & important things my baby needed. I spent a long time in the shop, it was probably a half hour or more. When I thought I had everything I needed, I went to cash up at the till. After all the selected items were scanned & packed, the total bill came to R3900 and just as I was handing the voucher for payment, the lady from the money market ran up to me and said there was something wrong with the voucher.Apparently she loaded the voucher incorrectly and gave me more money than she should have. The way she approached me was as if I had stolen something from the shop. She called the supervisor and the supervisor told me to pay R3900 for the goods. I told her I didn't have the money, so she said well then give the voucher back. There was no formal apology for the error they had made, nor did they show any form affection or compassion. I was so embarrassed, and what's worse was the fact that I had to leave all the items that were so carefully selected during that long time spent in store.After the confrontation, I found myself shaking and almost in tears. I handed the voucher back without a fuss, I then said I need to at least buy the aqueous cream & soap. I then extracted those items from the shopping bags, paid an additional R5 and left the store. There was Xtra savings card being swiped, which is another cause for concern. I don't even own one, so who gets the benefits on that card??I am really disappointed, I'm in shock, I've been humiliated, embarrassed and shamed and I am making you aware of It. It was not my fault that the employee made an error, why did I have pay greatly for her mistake?

As leader of your compony you understand the importance of hard work to make a success in life and to make your dreams become a reality. She is currently working at the Treatery in Howick KZN as an HR accountant and want to study a course in human resources to gain knowledge so she can broaden her knowledge to get a better work and accomplish her dreams. She also has the vision to open her own business in the future. 

It is really hard to get a good job without good qualification and experience.

My girlfriend wantï¿½s to applied to study human resources at the Academy of York College part time but there are some difficulties she need to overcome to be able to study:
1.	She does not have the funding to pay for the human resource courses herself.
2.	Her current work possession does not pay enough for her to be able to pay for the studies.
3.	For some of the courses they require a minimum salary of R5000 per month and she does not qualify. 
4.	 To get a NQF level 5 diploma in human resources she need an minimum amount of R28700 excluding the things she will need like a laptop.
 
My goal is to raise R50000 in order for my girlfriend to fully pay for the diploma and buy her a laptop.   The reason for this letter to gain your support with her studies so my girlfriend will be able to accomplish her diploma. Every little bit of your support will make a very big difference. 

We would like to thank you in advance for your support. Please feel free to contact me at 081 392 0868 or Bianca Muller at 083 791 5234 or at verweylouis@gmail.com.

Sincerely,


Louis Verwey

CHECKERS MANAGEMENT


To Whom It may Concern


This email is long overdue and I would like to inquire why the flavours of the best tasting yoghurt, DARLING YOGHURT, was changed more or less a year+ ago.

Me and my family have been emptying thousands of 1kg tubs over last 20 years and recently we find ourselves buying only 1 or 2 tubs per month. 

The old flavours of Darling Yoghurt was by far the best tasting yoghurt over all, comparing to all the other famous brands that are also available on the shelves. Darling has a taste that is truely yoghurt and not an artificial taste like all other brands.

I have called Darling and they told me that they have received hundreds of complaints about their new range. The message which was carried over by them, was that, there were some pressure from the distributors for the renewal of the DARLING YOGHURT brand. Some of the new flavours are really not what one expect from a fruity tasting yoghurt.

I think I speak for a lot of consumers who agree that we are missing the old flavours that are no longer available.

I hope that Checkers will reconsider and will start a conversation with DARLING DIARIES to see if you can bring us back all the old tasty flavours. 

I hope to here from Checkers management soon and too also see a change on the diary shelves one of these days.

Kind regards
Mr E Buhr

I have been a happy Checkers supporter for many, many years but not today!!

Yesterday I purchased two fold up outdoor chairs @ R179.99 each. I later decided to test one out. I tried to unfold the chair but it was a little tight, thought maybe it was like that due to not been used. When I sat on it, the chair collapsed and I fell on the tiles in a painful heap! I needed help to get up from my husband.

Today we returned both chairs to Checkers. The lady helping us hardly said a work other than to ask if we wanted to exchange them. I mentioned to her what had happened and that I was in a lot of pain! No response or apology was given!

I feel your front line staff / cashiers / packers dealing with customers need to be better trained and more friendly. Not all, but most of them are sadly lacking in this department.
Thanks Cathy

Today, 12.01.22 @ 17:30, I visited you checkers hyper store in N1 City, simply because itï¿½s close to home and on my way home. What an utter disappointment - thereï¿½s hardly stock in the shop, no 6 pack 300ml coke cans, only lemon flavored pump 6 packs, shelves at canned goods are poorly stocked and variety is so limited, fresh fruit and veg was the best cause there was hardly anything and the prepacked salad bowls has seen better days - green leaves are now brown, ready made meals had no options - there were a full 4 flavors to choose from, cold meats sliced and prepacked - empty shelves. This store has a clear management problem, planning arenï¿½t done properly and the shop is extremely dirty.  I normal drive all the way to the Brackenfell fairbridge branch (and I stay in Panorama) simply because itï¿½s well stocked, has a huge variety to choose from, FRESH fruit and veg, professional and friendly staff. Had a been a Monday at checkers hyper N1, it would be understandable that shelved might be empty, but itï¿½s WEDNESDAY! To top it all I had the worst and most unfriendly service from your cashier at till 5, according to the till slip her nameï¿½s: Yonela NJ. I wasnï¿½t greeted in a friendly manner, simply asked: bag? Whilst she was having a lekker chat with the packer at her till and the packer at till 4. I put the wrong pin in for a card payment - the cashier didnï¿½t tell me, no she decided to announce it to the packer and the till 4 packer. What is really disturbing as that, even though the wearing of face masks is mandatory and you expect all your clients to shop with a mask on covering a mouth and nose - your staff at checkers hyper n1 city is exempted from wearing a face mask correctly. All face masks are either only covering the mouth, hanging loosely on the chin or around the neck - I have noted your staff feel that they may do it to chat to colleagues about their personal life. Even the security check point at the house & home side, who are suppose to ensure all rules are abided by, weï¿½re chatting with masks on the chin.
This is unacceptable Checkers, surely you can do better, greeting a customer in a friendly manner Do not cost a cent - itï¿½s called manners and common decency. Your staff need urgent training, your shop is need of stock. Will checkers hyper N1 see me again, nope definitely not - thereï¿½s other competitive resalers in the same centre.
Please do something about the hygiene, staff, attitude, stock levels, stock variety, at this shop urgently - serious intervention and monitoring from a head office is required

Case Title: faulty lids: for attention Checkers Hyper Somerset Mall
Case Description: Customer DetailsName: Magdil BlignautLandline: Email: magdilblignaut@gmail.comAssigned To: Shirne FlowersCreated On: 2021-12-14T19:40:56Status: OpenCase Notes:Technical User SAP_SMTP_IN 2021-12-14T19:40:56 CATGood dayI trust that you are well!One of the best decisions in this side where I am staying in Kleinmond, is to take the drive Somerset West to Checkers.I buy most of my groceries, pots ect from you.I visited the shop on 13 December, together with my daughter, and bought glass bowls with lids.I am unable to close the lids, It seems that they are a bit too small.I just want to inform you now.I have not used the bowls or the lids.I opened them this morning, 14 December, and as it is Tuesday, I have taken the rubbish out, containing the packaging.I lightly rinsed them, by hand, in lukewarm warm after I washed them.This afternoon when I wanted to use them, I noticed that I am not able to close them.I am used to these kind of bowls, and have about 9 others, as I use them in my fridge, prepare and bake some dishes and also use them in the freezer  and all over.I know how to handle them, and how to take care of them.BUT it seems that these lids are a bit small, and I do not want to break them! So I will have to bring them back.I will not be able to drive to Somerset west soon in order to exchange them. Therefore I am forwarding this email now.I will not use the bowls and just put them aside until I can go again which most probably will be only in January.I had to pick up my grandson in Cape Town yesterday, and he was ill. So we had him tested and he tested  positive for Covid.I was the driver of my car, and he was sitting right behind me.  So I am confined to my house for a week or so and will have to isolate.Thank you for understandingAll the bestMagdil Blignaut0721 793 9904KleinmondWestern CapeDisclaimer:https://www.shopriteholdings.co.za/email-disclaimer.html

Case Title: Sixty60 App Stock and Delivery Service Order No. 21004864
Case Description:
This was by far the worst food shopping delivery service i have ever had. Please note that ALL my previous orders with you have had a problem too. I will NEVER be ordering from you AGAIN and will take my money somewhere else.
1. your stock availability should be shown before checkout and NOT AFTER checkout, understandably 1 item might have system defect but not half the items in the basket!
2. Your generated google maps should reflect the exact delivery address given as to NOT confuse drivers.
3. Drivers should be knowledgeable navigators and at least be able to give landmarks so that the customer can help them.
4. How does a driver tell a customer heï¿½s running out of airtime, this is unprofessional and ridiculous!
5, A driver should not be telling the customer off, AGAIN outrageous behaviour. 
5. Then after numerous customer service calls, you cancel my order, no reason or apology.
6. Your option to reorderï¿½re-ordering then costs me another bank charge which you donï¿½t cover all because of the ignorance of your system and driver.

Hope youï¿½re happy with your terrible service because you have lost a customer.

Nasheeta Masoet

I visited your store this morning. The young man working in the Fruit and Veg section made it quite clear he was annoyed to have to come away from stacking shelves to weigh my produce and wasnï¿½t wearing his mask. I asked him to do so. He refused to look at me throughout our interaction. He then happened to pass me at the till on his way to his break obviously around 12:45 and again his mask was off in store. I have lost friends and family to Covid, and seen my entire industry decimated. It is shocking and unacceptable that your staff think so little of the law and consideration for others. He was walking with another staff member and past other staff member NONE of whom bothered to ask him to keep his mask on. There is obviously a culture of not caring at Checkers. He also clearly fears no reprocussions, and knows he can do as he pleases. I have shopped at this store every week, sometimes twice a week for 4 years, and during this time it has steadily gotten worse. Iï¿½ll not be doing so again. While Iï¿½m sure you care nothing for the loss of my business, for the safety of your customers and other staff please make some attempt to follow the law that is backed by science.

Dear Reader,

We are Sizanane Holdings Pty Ltd based in Postmasburg. We would like to make you aware of a situation that occurred last year. One of our drivers went to pick up the employees after they knocked off from their shift. When he arrived there with the 15 seater taxi, he realized that not all of them would get into the taxi and he had to comply with COVID regulations. so he decided to drop off  the ones he could manage to take and come back for the others. The following day they went and told the managers that the driver left them and the manager decided to cancel the contract without informing the owners in a professional manner of the situation. We went for a meeting with them. The only response we got was that they will get back to us. week after week we went back for feedback but no feedback from them till this day.we honestly feel that the situation could have been handled in a professional way. That lady was so rude when I asked her about that rule of theirs. I had to take my groceries and try to go to the taxi rank with them. I don't think I will ever visit that store again as I was treated badly.

Case Title: Praise for Manager of ShopRite Northam
Case Description:

I have been buying from shoprite &  checkers stores since i can remember, and before me my grandparents did.

However, numerous times now have i bought rotten maize and flour, leaving it everytime as i do understand things happen. During last week i again purchased products worth more then R1000, only to find the following - worms in the cake flour and maize meal, veggies kept in my fridge rotten within 1 day, bacon that had a horrific smell once i opened it the following day and chicken that was all white at the bottom and slimy. This is honestly becoming a problem now - most of us are struggling to make ends meet and then we have to deal with this. Personally i feel this is unacceptable - im a 28year old self employed woman taking care of an elderly person, and when concerns are raised managment almost LAYING DOWN in their chairs simply shrug their shoulders demanding items and slips, though i have mentioned to them it was thrown away as i normally do with waste etc. Please it cant go on like this, what about our rights as consumer?

I slipped and fell in shoprite Rustenburg on 24/12/2021, the manager said he would contact me after he pulled camera footage but when we were there this week, the camera angle was conveniently pointed in the other direction.  He promised to send me an email to admit it was not my fault but until today I have received nothing. I had back surgery not too long ago and I got really hurt with this fall, I would not do this deliberately because I need to take care of m back otherwise they will have to operate again.  I hurt my back ral bad with the fall, my coccyx and my wrist and knee as well. the wrist was just sprained and is okay. but my back and knee still hurts, and I have severe pain when i walk. This means that I will go have to see a specialist and I cannot do it ow since work is hectic.  I missed Christmas and New Year due the pain i was experiencing, I could not work for two weeks I just laid in bed because it was too painful to move.  So what do we do about this, My salary is R14109.10, which means I get R470.30 per day x 14 days no work = R6584.25, and that is not all, I have received an account from Ferncrest Hospital that I owe them R233, and I am not going to pay that.  So tell me what happens next are you going to settle my loss of income or shall i ask a lawyer to handle this for me which is going to cost you more since I am innocent in all this and you will be paying my lawyer at the end of the day as well. Also you need to compensate me for pain and suffering, but the amount is up to you. Since I am still suffering from back and knee pain, see the pics of my knee attached. Please refer to the correct department, because I wanted to be civil and asked that manager over and over again to send me and email, and my medical aid might also still send me an account for the ambulance that picked me up from shoprite as they don't work through provincial ambulance services, they use ER24. Your cooperation will be highly appreciate it as it seem your manager at that specific store is unfit to do his job. Thank you.  Annelle M Retief, 0713781038

Case Title: Complaint: Poor Customer Service from Manager
Case Description:
On the 17 January 2022, I went to the Shoprite liquor at Baramall shopping center in Soweto, purchased 4 bottles of 910 ml castle lite, as usual I brought empty bottles to get the discount. 
When I went to the till to pay the cashier said they will not consider my empty bottles as it is 15min before they close I should pay full price. 
II asked why she said the manager said so. 
I paid full price and asked for the. Manager, Eugene the manager showed up. 
I explained the situation and he refused to give me the receipt that I brought empty bottles which were now in the shops possession. I said to him that... I have paid full price but give me receipt to acknowledge bottles taken, his response was that when I come back he will remember me. 
Really is that how managers are trained to deal with customers.
If indeed it is policy that no empty bottles will be accepted 15min before shop closes, can a clear notice be displayed.
I feel like I was robbed it was not much to the next person but it is still money.

Brian
0834947328

16.01.22 customer went to the money market where she stood in a queue, Diana Matlala was assisting while the other 2 cashiers were not assisting. Diana told customer after waiting 20 minutes that there is no queue where they are standing they need to join the queue outside. Customer then stood behind the 2 people who were not there when she entered the store. Customer asked the 2 cvustomers standing in the que whether should could go as they were not there, they agreed and she went ahead. Diana refused to assist the customer and called the next person. Customer requested to speak with the Manager and Diana apparently responded it is not her job to call a Manager, she should go find a Manager. Customer told Diana that because of her attitude she would stay behind the till, Diana then called customer a very bad name which says she is a foreigner, housewife from Mozambique. Customer says she even tried to throw the tillpoint at Diana, eventually anther lady called the customer and tried to assist but Diana continued talking. Eventually a Manager came and took the customer to the office, they called Diana to the officer and she refused to apologise saying customer is a "housewife" from a foreign country. Eventually they called the Branch Manager and Diana lied to the Branch Manager saying that the customer did not want to accept her apology, she even lied in front of the 2 managers who then told they customer they do not know what to do. Customer could knot believe that Diana treated Management and herself with such disrespect. As per customer "shangaan - lekwarpa from Mozambique is such a disrespectful statement which comes from apartheid days she will not allow this to go unpunished as no person will make her feel like an uneducated foreigner. Customer is exceptionally hurt and will not tolerate the service she received and the lies told.

I type this message with a very heavy heart and utter disgust at the condition of the Shoprite Sesfikile Branch in Daveyton.I went there on the morning of 7 January 2022 to pick up only 3 items. The lines were all packed (I must have counted about 25 people in front of me) and there were 9 tills open but no staff. I might just add that my experience everytime I go there is similar. There has never been a time Iï¿½ve been there and not spent more than 30 minutes waiting in the que.I asked the manager Noxolo why they were understaffed seeing that thereï¿½s so many paying customers. In true Shoprite style she was rude and dismissive and told me that itï¿½s HRs responsibility to ensure thereï¿½s adequate staff.Shoprite was built and continues to survive on the money of the impoverished black people and it makes no sense that we spend our hard earned cash there only to receive a ridiculously horrible shopping experience. I would like for someone to look into this as to ensure that the service we receive there is of the same standard as it would be in any white neighborhood. I would also like to be contacted and kept in the loop on how the stakeholders of Shoprite plan to make this right as this is a huge violation of the values of your company. Your staff does not care about the needs of their customers, they are rude and disrespectful. I also would like to lay a complaint on the manager and staff on duty. I will not be subjected to the constant disrespect that the customers received at the hands of your staff.Iï¿½m hoping this complaint can be taken seriously and that serious remedial action be taken at the branch.

Case Title: Return Refused - Faulty Kettle & Poor Service
Case Description: Customer is unhappy about the manner in which he was assisted in store with an enquiry about a faulty kettle.He purchased a Platinum 1.7 Cordless Kettle last year in January 2021. He returned it to store today as it is faulty.Customer approached management for assistance. They simply turned him away because he did not have a till slip, only the box of the kettle.They told him about not being able to retrieve it using the barcode, but if he swiped Xtra Savings card, they can. However the manner in which he was assisted was not very pleasant. He says this has been the case for years at the store, when it comes to after sale service. Management is standing with arms folded and seems to have some sort of smirk under their mask.I explained to customer that till slip is necessary in order determine date of purchase, which will determine whether customer is still within warranty period, and also in first 6 months or second 6 months of warranty. He understood this.He feels that if they had approached him a different manner, he would have understood and ended up purchasing a new kettle instead. Customer says this really needs to be addressed.I apologised and advised I will report it to store Senior Management.

Good Day, 

I am writing this email to complain about the humiliation that I have just received Shoprite in Kempton Park - Central Ave around 1:30 PM today. 

I bought a few items at the store and paid at till 7. I don't know what I did with the till slip and only realised when the security asked for it at the door that I'd lost it. 

When I was about to leave, the security asked for the till slip - which I realised I had lost. So they wouldn't let me out without producing the slip. 

At first I went to the cashier I paid at and asked if she could go back and print another one for me as only 1 or 2 people had paid after me - which she said she couldn't (according to my knowledge slips can be saved and retrieved by cashiers). I then looked around to see if I'd dropped it and looked in my bag and still couldn't find it. 

So I went back to the security and asked if they can ask a manager or whoever to sort this out so I can leave. To the security's excitement, he took my groceries and asked that I follow him to what I'm assuming is a control room/ some office. A Shoprite staff member with an attitude (and he'll know what I'm referring to) then came and asked the till I paid at and the amount, and was able to retrieve the slip in seconds. 

My actual complaint here is about how this thing was handled - firstly the security who's probably had nothing exciting going on for him the whole day makes a judgment that I might have stolen the stuff by the way he carried on. That guy treated me like I was some thief in a store full of people. 
If no one can get out with their groceries without the slip- why is there no disclaimer saying so because I never keep grocery receipts?  
If the slip can be retrieved, why must I be following the security around and taken to the store's back rooms when I could've just stood there by the door with another security that was there, while he does the up and down by himself to see if I'd stolen the stuff or not. 

After that ordeal, when they've finally retrieved the slip- I did not even get an apology. Instead on my way out, the female security asks if the goods are really mine. 

What kind of service is this? Is it because of the store predominantly caters for a certain race group which never complains about service? Superior service is reserved for stores in areas catering for certain LSMs? 

The store and it's contractors can do better. 

Regards, 
Ntombomzi

Case Title: Poor Customer Experience - Standard Bank Cash Send
Case Description: Not @Shoprite_SA store in Tembisa Mall denying the part of withdrawing @StandardBankZA cash send in their store made them read the sms and they were like.Hello. This is in relation to the above pic. I was in the Mall of Tembisa store sometime last week. It was after 6 abf unfortunately the only standard bank atm in the mall was offline and other shops were closedThe staff at Shoprite said they don't know anything about the withdrawal of a standard bank cash send

I am disappointed in the way Shoprite employees and the security  guards handled a simple matter that was at hand. Coming from work very tired I am thinking that I need to do my groceries. I went to Shoprite Mall of Tembisa as it is the nearest shop and I enjoy doing my shopping there. As I was paying for my groceries at the till the cashier Nyeleti is helping me  to pay and after that she was packing my groceries she leaves 2 items and immediately I let her know that she did not pack these 2 items and she just stares at me with attitude on her face and I had to pack them. As I left the till I was on my way to the exit, as I got to the exit the security guards stopped me and asked for my receipt. I searched for the receipt in my handbag when I couldn't find it I told them I had paid for my groceries but they didn't listen to me. They manhandled me stopping me from passing the exit just because I told them that I lost my receipt. I then told the  security guard lady that she can't stop me from passing the exit because I paid. She then called other security people to block me as if I stole when I didn't. I tried pushing them stopping them from blocking my way so that I can go home and prepare dinner for my family. One male security came to the exit door and immediately lifted and carried me and took me to the admin office. While they carried me Busi Lorraine Maluka pulled my hair roughly as if we are fighting. I did not like the way he was carrying me because he was touching my private part all the way till I got to the admin office. When I got to the admin office there were a group of ladies who were laughing about my situation. I got surprised when I got there because the ladies there were joking about what happened instead of coming with the solution and calming the customer as it was not the best experience. Luckily after that one lady came to me and asked what happened and I explained everything. She calmed me and started resolving my situation. Me standing in the office admin I became a clown and it was a circus as they came in one by one to stress me even more instead of calming me down. Outrageously one other lady made a comment saying that I should know that in the black community Shoprite Checkers it is their procedure that they should always make sure that the black customers don't steal and they must be searched and should also produce proof to prove that they did not steal. It is inappropriate for the Shoprite's employee to blare that out even if it is the procedure. I am also disappointed that Shoprite has rules that are racist that in black communities we should be treated like trash but in white communities they should be treated with respect. Even worse my groceries were all over the place and my bank card is now broken which is an additional cost they have to deduct in my bank for me to replace the bank card. The shirt that I was wearing is also torn because they were manhandling me. The worst thing is that I was wearing my work uniform, this has tarnished my name and I don't think I'll ever be comfortable shopping at Shoprite Mall of Tembisa. I am still traumatised by the experience and don't think I will recover from that.

I never felt so belittled and humiliated in my life as if I stole while I paid for everything. The only sin I had made is that I was trying to exit the shop without drama and with the goods that are fully paid. I think Shoprite should start investing in training their customer to good customer service and treating customers with respect. We take our our hard earned  money to support Shoprite and their employees don't respect that. I also work with customer and I make sure that I treat customers with respect because without them it means that I don't have my work.

I would also like to thank the lady who helped to resolve the situation calmly. Out of all the people who were present in the office she is the only one who was helpful and dealt with everything professionally. I commend her for her professionalism and good customer service.

I hope this matter will be dealt with urgency.

Regards 
Nonkululeko Mthembu

On the 11th of January 2022, i went to buy school Stationary and groceries at Shoprite Vereeniging. The customer service in your shop is pathetic and shocking. As busy as it was with back to school preparation the shop had 6 till opened. Five was for items more than 10 and 1 was an express till. The shop was packed, one would swear it was Black Friday. The store was packed and queues were very long. As i was finalizing my purchase it was difficult to get some items from the shelves because the queues were blocking us from searching for items we were looking for. The people in the queues were getting irritated with  ?shoppers asking them to move because they have been on the queues for more that an hour. Some customers were fighting in the shop because the customer said to they guy "Move" the guy retaliated and said "are you instructing me or is it a request". Both client were right the problem here was Shoprite not doing anything to manage the situation. I wanted to cry when i saw an old lady sitting on the floor waiting for her turn to pay. What happened to "Ubuntu" and taking care of our senior citizens? We need to remember that some of these elders have chronic diseases, why do we have to make them wait for more that an hour to pay? One day one of your customer will leave the shop with an Ambulance stretcher if you continue treating senior citizens they way your shop does. Should i only worry about elders? Then my turn came to pay for my items, then i realised it's  my turn to be irritated by customers pushing me with  trollies because they need items they came to buy. I went to the office and asked to speak to someone regarding the service. I spoke to Wayne, I asked him why do they have 5 till's opened when there's long queues. The response was "We dont have staff" . I asked if he was the manager and he said  Lawrence is the manager. When i asked to speak to Lawrence, Wayne said he doesn't know where he is. Wayne was less interested with the issues i was raising. He just didn't care because he walked away without even apologizing for the inconvinience the shop is causing to customers. I went back to the queue and waited for 1hour and 45 min to pay. Shoprite has no respect for its customers. It's like operating your business you are doing us a favour. We are spending money to pay so it would be good to start being considerate. Did it ever occur to you that people love Shoprite because it is affordable? It makes sense why your competitors are coming closer to your shops. Your service is pathetic and soon your customers will understand their value because no one wants to be treated they way you treat your customers. What's more disappointing is that it did not only happen yesterday, its normal thing for customers to wait long in the queues at your Vereeniging branch. If i had permission from all customers i could have taken picture's and posted them on social media but because i understand the law i did not take pictures. Nothing stops me from asking permission from customers when i tell them why Shoprite does not value them. I am very upset that my shopping for R4000 was worth 1hour and 45 minutes and having to deal with your arrogant cashiers. I don't blame them because i asked one of them why is she so grumpy she was honest to say "I am hungry, i have not eaten lunch and its now 17:45. Then i realised you are not only treating your customers like trash but you are also violating the Labour Relations Act and you are exploiting your employees. These matter should be reported to the department of labour.I am going to visit Shoprite again but this time i wont go as a customer. If i find those long queues, i will make your shop trend for treating customers like trash. I hope you do understand that long waiting time costs you sales and soon these customers will start eating from your shelves because i saw it happening. People were taking items and eating and i don't blame them because it does not make sense to wait for more than an hour on a shop that has more than 12 tills. I understand that you can't open all tills at the same time but understand your customers feet flow then the manager can plan accordingly. Month ends he has to have enough staff to operate the tills. All i see here is that the manager hardly walk to floor to check things in the shop. You know why pick n pay has junior managers cubicle by the tills?  it's for them to identify issues  and attend to  customers. At shoprite you have to look for a manager then we come cross people like Wayne who don't care what you are saying. Please visit your shop and view cameras you will see the torture you're doing to your customers. I hope the issues i hraised above will be attended to. Kind Regards, Nelly Mabaso

I am a senior citizen and new to this area. Good day Question: Does Shoprite have an electronic system that is used to identify Best Before Dates? I am asking this because I have seen a few complaints from people who have bought expired products and I also experienced the same from Shoprite Riverside Square where the product had a Best Before Date of Nov-2021 and I bought it recently on 9 January 2022.  To add, I went back to return the product and it took more than 20 minutes from the time I handed over the product and the slip to when I finally got my refund of less than R20, again, I think it is unreasonable wait that long for such a simple procedure, I say simple because I have returned goods in other stores and my transaction generally takes 3 to 5 minutes at most. Finally, I went back to the same shelf where I picked up the expired products and found them there still, this was yesterday on the 15th of January 2022 which means many people who are unaware are going to consume products that may not be safe for their health. Actually, I have another comment to make with regards to efficiency, specifically relating to the cashiers. Kindly train them to ask people if they need plastic bags at the beginning of the transaction and the cashier must provide the bag at the earliest possible opportunity and also at the very least open the bag so that we can start packing our goods. Without that implementation we have two problems: One is time because when you give me the bag at the end of the transaction, it will take me/us longer to pack the goods thereby delaying the next transaction since the till only has so much space, in any case, even if the till was bjg enough, there is no reason for the customer to wait if they can start packing the goods earlier. And then as you may be aware, opening plastic bags can be tricky when your hands are dry so it is another frustrating and time wasting process which can be solved easily as suggested above. Your response will be appreciated.

On wednesday 19.01  I went to Triomf Shoprite for  tenderised steak as it is on special. We asked the butcher Morne if we can get 10kg, as little fat as possible or no fat if he can. He said it was fine. Well he called he  said we can get it yesterday. After my husband collected the steak I needed to pack and freeze it. Well to my utter dismay all the meat except 2 pieces were full of fat. Those 2 were on top as an eyeblind I would say.  I have a few pics that I took and sent it to Morne. He was a bit confused as he said he trimmed most of the fat off. Needless to say I threw all of the fat away, i could have got at least another 5 pieces of meat from there. We do not eat fat, that was the reason we asked for little or no fat. If he could not do it, he should have said so.He said we could come get a refund but the security guy at the door kept our slip and he refused to give it back. What if I bought someone which has a warranty, what then???? So needless to say I could not take the meat back. I am very disappointed and disgusted. From the pics u can see that there was no trimming of excess fat unless there is something wrong with my eyes.

Customer sent his son on 21/01/2022 to buy the Mosqiuto spray, as per his son the PI label pricing indicated R69.99 however at the till it scanned R129.99. The cashier sent one of the staff members to go and check the price and she came back confirming it to be R69.99. His son was then sent back to get another item in which he had to open a box.As he was walking out of the store he was then topped by the Security and the security guy said to him the item he has is not the correct one as it is supposed to be in a pack. He claims his son was treated like he has stolen the item where as he bought. While they were keeping his son at the store as if he is a criminal, some random guy approached his son; he then asked for R10 and said he will help sorting out the matter. His son gave this person the requested money assuming he is one of the merchandising people as he did come across one that was not wearing uniform and at this stage he was panicking as he did not know what was going on. They released his son without even apologizing for what has happen. Immediately after his son shared his experience the customer took his son and they went back to the store, he asked for the manager and a guy whom introduced himself as the branch manager came to assist. According to the customer, the managerï¿½s approach and attitude was very bad. The manager indicated to the customer his son was not supposed to open the box and no valid reason provided as to why he was not allowed to open the boxes. They both him and the manager went to check the price and they could not find any price tag of R129.00. While the customer was busy addressing the matter indicating the fact that his son was also robbed at the store, the manager mentioned to the customer he is wasting his time and that he needed to go and attend to other customers. The customer mentioned they got into some sort of an argument as he was questioning the fact that he is being told he is wasting his time, he then asked him what could be his role and asked for the managers name as he was not impressed in the manner in which he was dealing with the matter. The manager then mentioned he is the Assistant manager and mentioned his name while walking away from the customer of which the customer did not get it. After speaking with the manager, the security guy came and mentioned to the customer they are the ones that have stopped his son. The security guy further indicated that this is not the first time someone is being robbed at the store of which according to the customer the store knows about the problem and doing nothing about which clearly means more people will be robbed at the store by people who pretend to be staff.Customer would like for the matter to be addressed and he demands feedback and better treatment from the store.

On the 16/01/2022 I went to buy a scientific calculator. On the shelf the price tag was R100. When at the till point it rang R169. I queried that this was not the price that was displayed and marked at the shelf. A controller checked and indeed found that this was the case.

The Manager on duty by the name Cidwell (Fresh Food Manager) indicated to the controller that he will not allow me to pay the displayed price as such I should have read the barcode and the item features. I was shocked and livid. Is it the responsibility of customer to read barcodes when we buy at Shoprite.

The one Manager Cidwell outrightly refused me to pay the displayed price and ended up paying R69 extra. I did not appreciate the way I was treated by your Manager. He was condescending, disrespectful and arrogance at highest order. 

As a customer I believe I should have been given the item with the price displayed but he remostrated and refused as if it was packed by me. I am not happy about this treatment. Your Manager interactions with customers should change if at all that's how he deals with customers. I deserve to be respected as a customer. I only got respect from the controller compared to the Manager who should lead by example. 

Moreover he even indicated that I can report anywhere he does not care. Let me be clear here even if the displayed price was R200 or any amount I would have paid. Here the issue was the displayed price was the amount I was prepared to pay. 

Is this how Shoprite treats customers.

Guys,  Please. This shop is not safe and I will raise this awareness about this allowed behavior on all social media platforms. You guys are allowing this behavior,  ask your cashiers they will tell you all the information of this pervert. Walks around the shop nothing in hand but just touches women's behinds.

Case Title: Poor Customer Treatment - Accused of Theft
Case Description: Yesterday I went to a Shoprite in KhayelitshaSince I just moved I am sorting out my place - I went to get take away and quickly get a cold drink (Monster)I went to the Kiosk to pay for itOn my way out the security guard stopped me - he asked to look in my bagI said that there must be a proper way to do this and in a respectful wayUntil you know that I stole somethingI don't want to take it personally but let's do it in respectful mannerLet's not disrespect each otherHe said I don't have to tell you anything I just need to see what's in your bagI am standing there feeling embarrassed and he is reaching for my bagThe bag with the groceries - he can see what is sideI said I will open my sling bag - please make sure that you don't touch what is insideIt was my church stuff and I did not want him touching itThere were two bottles of 1.5 still water and one small oneAs we are talking - he is asking where are the slips for these itemsI told him I don't have it because I bought it in the morning from SparShoprite was packed - I was rushing. The take away is right next the storeHe was talking to me in a disrespectful manner After that a senior security person came and asked what is wrongThe lady said let's go to the back and we will lookI thought it will resolve the matterSo I asked are we going to view the footage because this is becoming too muchThe lady then leaves me at the back with this security and a different ladyI repeated that I don't have the slip - the other bag has the groceriesHe keeps asking for the slip and I did not plan to be back at the storeI am sure it won't take them long to check the camerasHe kept asking for the slip - even at the door, he says that I did not declare these itemsI apologised and told him that I was rushingI tried my best to cooperate. I understand that they have a difficult job and I am sure that there is a way to resolve it.The other lady then grabs my bag, I asked her why grab it and not ask.Until you know that I stole here, I should be treated with respect.There were staff coming in and out and she treated them with respect but is not showing the same respect to me.I don't have a problem with you wanting to search me or stopping me.We went back and forth.I offered to take out the items. As I am taking out the stuff - she is looking at the bottom of the bag.There was sugar from Spar, Milk from Spar, Douwe Egberts Coffee 200g, Lifegain supplement.She called over the phone and told someone else that it is from Spar.I asked her if they sell these items here - she did not know.They were treating me like trash. Screaming at me saying don't tell us how to do our jobs.I was feeling scared that they might beat me and I tried my best to cooperate.While I am talking to them, the lady that told us to come to this room comes back and questions me.I understand that I don't have the slip and I understand that people steal but my issue was the manner in which the handled the matter.I then asked if I am guilty or what there conclusion is.I did not declare the items but I don't think that is worth the disrespect I got.They told me to go to the office and they will give me the names.She then pulls me aside and said I would like to apologise for the way they dealth with the matter.She should have addressed this in front of them because they did me wrong.It's like she was just protecting her colleagues and patronizing me.I packed my stuff and followed her but then she was leading me out of the store.I asked to speak to the security's manager.Eventually he gives me the names and I left.I called the number that the lady provided me for the manager but it did not go through.Then I called the store and then said I can come back to the store today and they will arrange a meeting with the manager.I then said that this seems to be escalating - now I am taking time out of my day to resolve this matter.My problem is the way that this matter was handled. The lady that works for Shoprite (she helped me when I bought the monster) apologised.This guy may do this to someone else.After that the lady - the second security guard, she came back and I realised that she was told that I did not steal anything. She just got rid of the guy.She lied to me and said that I will give you the names.They did not apologise.My biggest concern is the disrespect.Customer does not feel comfortable to give the name of the securities. He does not want anyone to get fired. He feels that Shoprite should investigate the type of training that the securities get and is concerned that the securities will treat other customers like this.

We have a serious complaint against Shoprite Lady Grey, Paarl. 
The service in this store is, and has been, absolutely dreadful, if what is available in the store can even be called ï¿½serviceï¿½. 
ï¿½	Over weekends, which is a very busy, there are AT BEST three or four tills open in a store that has at least twelve to fifteen available. WHY? In a country with such a high unemployment rate Iï¿½m fairly certain there are enough people available to hire to man all the tills. If you canï¿½t find any, I can provide you with an army of people looking for work. 
ï¿½	The cashiers that are actually in the store are rude, unresponsive and unhelpful. They do not greet clients, and if they can be bothered to make eye contact their entire attitude is one of 
ï¿½Iï¿½m doing you a favour to scan these items and you are massively inconveniencing me to be shopping hereï¿½ ï¿½ if you donï¿½t want to scan the items, we can always just take the stuff and leave? Would that be alright?
ï¿½	When asking for help from floor employees, we receive the same exact treatment. It is an absolute inconvenience for a floor employee stacking shelves to just look up, acknowledge a client and point them vaguely in the direction of the shelf theyï¿½re looking for. Again ï¿½ we are really sorry to be such an inconvenience to you while youï¿½re busy with the absolutely critical and heavily complex task of stacking cans on a shelf, but we would dearly like to know where a certain item is, so that we may purchase it, and contribute to the store paying your salary. We are not asking for a red carpet and a crown, we are asking for basic manners and a little assistance. 

Sunday 16 January, my husband went to pick up some groceries at Shoprite Lady Grey and returned in such a state of shock and frustration it took an hour to calm down. 
The so-called express till is possibly the slowest till in the store, with a waiting time of 40 minutes, with 7 people in a queue. In contrast, when visiting OK Foods at Rembrandt Mall in Paarl, the queue can be standing across the store to the back at the dairy and the longest waiting time we have experienced was 15 MINUTES. This is shameful. 
When my husband realised he had forgotten 1 simple item, he returned to purchase it, thinking he will quickly get it from the cigarette counter. At the cigarette counter, which I have to point out is slow even at the best of times AND DOES NOT SELL STATIONERY a lady with an ENTIRE TROLLEY of back-to-school items was getting THE ENTIRE TROLLEY REFUNDED. 
WHY is this allowed at the cigarette counter? Why is there no-one else available in that massive store to assist with a refund, so other customers can be helped?
The gentleman in the queue with my husband abandoned his groceries in the store too, seeing as how they werenï¿½t about to be helped in this century still. 

This is what your lack of efficiency and poor management has caused:
ï¿½	 Massive stress and anxiety in an autistic person
ï¿½	The abandonment of items needed, which means we will now not only have to go spend MORE money than we would have initially if we were able to purchase what we needed at your store
ï¿½	An extra trip to a different store to purchase the needed items ï¿½ more fuel wasted, more time wasted

Here is my questions:
ï¿½	In a country riddled with unemployment, why do you not have any staff available?
ï¿½	Why is your available staff so poorly mannered and unhelpful?
ï¿½	Why are there only four till points open on a weekend, especially when there are specials on like Back-to-School?
ï¿½	Why is a trolley full of stationery allowed to take up an entire till point, effectively taking that counter ï¿½offlineï¿½ seeing as how it is also too much effort for a cashier to get a packet of cigarettes if one is paying at another counter, and you have to go stand in that line to be helped?
ï¿½	What if the item my husband needed to buy was urgent? What if, for example, someone had cut themselves and needed a plaster ï¿½ by the time the person buying the plaster re-emerged from the store, the person in the car has what, bled to death?
ï¿½	We live in a time where mental health is actually acknowledged ï¿½ so what if a paranoid schizophrenic has mustered the courage to buy a loaf of bread, and is experiencing an attack while waiting an hour in a line of five people, and freaks out? Maybe stabs someone? Attacks someone?  What happens when your lack of management and poor organization causes someone with severe anxiety or autism to have a meltdown in the store? Who is liable? 

When I stepped on my own car keys, in the parking lot ï¿½ not even inside the store ï¿½ because of my own clumsiness, and twisted my ankle, the staff could not have embarrassed me more. They had to fetch a wheelchair, take my blood pressure and then follow me around the store while I bought carrots and bread. It was my own fault, my own clumsiness, and I was fine. The staff was all over me, making a massive scene and causing a lot of embarrassment. 
But when we NEED ACTUAL ASSISTANCE there is none available. 
If it is such a massive inconvenience for you and your staff to assist people who are supporting your store, if we have to go somewhere else to buy items we need because the till is closed, the floor staff couldnï¿½t be bothered to help us find something, or the store is simply too panic-inducing, we will go somewhere else IN ANY EVENT and make sure to take as many people with us as we can. 

This store has functioned in the past. Since April 2020 this store has simply become an absolute nightmare for anyone trying to shop there.
Please advise why your stores stock old stockshoprite paarl lady grey

Case Title: Customer fell ill after consumption - MCB 112918
Case Description: As per telephonic conversation my complaint is as follows.On the 21st January 2022 I bought of Shoprite Westridge Mitchell's plain some goods to the  value of R767,05 including the meat Texan steak value of R50,48 .when I arrived home I fried the steak ,while eating the meat I discovered it had an off smell and I looked at the expiring date and noticed it was to be expired on the 29/01/2022 .I ate a quarter piece of the steak and had a stomach bug I ended up vomiting .The following morning (Saturday) I took the meat to ShopRite as it was on my route to the doctor .As per the store management version the heat could be the cause of the off rotten meat and it could have been the temperature of the fridges. The manager offered to refund my money and replace the meat .Due to the seriousness of my illness I could not accept their offer .He however acknowledge that the meat was off together with the butcher managers .The doctor treated me for food poison and I am not allowed to work until Thursday the 27/01/2022 depending on how I recover .my request is that Shoprite inform me on how they willing to compensate me for damages ,loss of earnings and inconveniences. Trust we can resolve the matter internally.

Case Title: Complaint - Old Chicken & Poor Store Environment
Case Description: To whom it may concernI have purchased chicken packs at your store in Westridge Mitchells Plain on Friday 28th January.After defrosting the chicken this morning it has a very very fowl smell and is slimy.I took the risk to purchase chicken at this store because the butchery has the smell of death, i mean it stinks in that store every day all day.( I had complained about this previously only for the store manager to call me and put me on the line with the butchery supervisor who then told me that she burns incense every morning to camouflage the smell) how crazy is that!!!!!! I mean really who does this!!!!However i thought maybe the chicken would be fine because its not handled in the butchery of the store.What a huge disappointment to my day to discover that I only have semonela bacteria for lunch.I am appalled by the unhygienic conditions of this store...fresh produce are always old, water running from ceilings in the toiletry aisle, butchery that smells like a mortuary.....i could go on and on....Disgusted customerA.Pass

Case Title: Minor not allowed in liquor store
Case Description: I went to Greytown Shoprite Liquor and was told that my 9year old daughter must wait by the door by herself. Witch i was horrified about in this age that we live in. Both the security and the till man were very rude to me and showed dominance as i was a women alone. I know nothing will be done about it so this is just a msg to say that i will tell the whole town about this and i will never purchase from any such store ever again. The law states that no alcohol may be sold to a child under 18. If accompanied by an adult they are allowed to enter. I am disgusted at how i was treated.
Store Contact Details Enquiry

I recently had an altercation with a security guard at the Shoprite Liquor in Mt Ayliff. I've been a regular patron for over 4 years. Today was the first time I've ever had to have my receipt checked at the door and when I asked why the man grab my wrists and and pulled my receipt out of the plastic bag I was carrying. This has been building up for a while now and I tried my best to ignore it but today's altercation was humiliating to say the least being treated like a criminal in an establishment I frequently visit left a sour taste in my mouth. On more than one occasion I could tell the same security guard was following me around while I shopped I don't know if this is company policy but I feel all customers should be treated the same allowing guards to cherry pick and harass certain customers while others are treated with dignity is just wrong there needs to be consistent action for everyone. I have never stolen anything nor do I have a criminal record and what further compounds the matter is that this is only done to people of colour I want to understand whether it is normal for Shoprite to apply racial profiling and classism in the way security is handled we deserve to be treated equally

Shoprite,It is with great disappointment that I write this piece, I was almost robbed at Nkandla Shoprite had I not looked at my slip.I bought my grocery and asked the cashier to also add R500 cashback, after the transaction the cashier told me that they couldn't process the cashback because of the network issues, without paying any attention I grabbed my till slip and left the till before I could reach the door something said I should read the till slip.to my surprise the cashback of R500 was reflected and successfully transacted on the till slip, I went back to the till for further explanation on the till slip before I could cause any havoc the cashier provided me with my cash and told me that she was just making me aware of scams like these, and I should be attentive in future.I posted this on the Nkandla Facebook page and to my surprise I'm not the only one who has been done like this.with respect and humbleness, I am reporting this and I request that you take this matter seriously, and I will be following it till its resolution.You are one of the biggest brands on the whole continent, I believe you will treat this complaint with the severity it deserves

I frequently visit the said shop for different needs. 
What transpires there is a dynamic set of challenges that leads to almost none service .
This range from very poor employees' performance creating unnecessary long queues .
This occurs mainly at kiosk where money transfers, lotto, cigarettes are handled. 
I used to spend +/_ 2 hours on the queue. Sometimes just to find out that the intended service is not available. 
That could be easily avoided. 
Most the time just one person is allocated there for almost an endless queue of different services while there are more than one service points. 
This can be due to short stuff or very poor management. 
All the till points seems do not care of the very long queues looking at the slowly pace they move .
That can be due to incapacity of the employees,  the system used or very poor supervision/management. 
Worse when few till are opened while the queues are very long.
Clearly poor management. 
I recommend that lotto machine be removed or more personal be added .
For out of service or down times periods , this should be attended on the queue regularly to avoid queueing for nothing. 
The exhausted employee tends to loose temper and creates more challenges in her/his responses and activities to us as customers .
The till system should be upgraded to match the demand and the nowerday's operations.
Tills should be closely monitored to increase their opened number sooner it becomes necessary. 
To stay at Chechers the day long for a single service democrats very poor service/management for the well-known shop like Usave.
Thank you for attending customer's concern

Case Title: Customer asked to leave the store because of what she was we
Case Description: I hope this reaches you well even though I was hurt by the treatment from one of your stores of which I also have footage for.My name is Zimbali Blom, fashion designer, model, vocalist and a loyal, regular customer at Shoprite near Katlehong North Police Station (ERF 2175 Masakhane Street) to purchase bathing toiletries and deposit money into my account for my monthly subscriptions.What had happened was that I went into Shoprite at around 10:30am on Monday the 3rd of January 2022, shopping around for best prices on toiletries, cross-buns and washing powder soap when security guards started following me around the store, leaving their posts until one approached me asking me to leave the store, when I asked what the problem was, she told me the store manager said my clothing was inappropriate. After asking how I was being inappropriate as my clothing showed no private parts of any kind and over the hot pants I had a mini tennis skirt on and a loose crop top shirt. In my knowledge inappropriate clothing means you are exposing private parts to the public., I should also express that I make my own clothes and I have had a problem before with a jump-suit I made myself before; where I was denied access even though I have seen people with store bought jumpsuits being let into the store. Today I was let in the store and later kicked out which means the security guard saw nothing wrong about my clothing until someone else commented. I would like say that I was deeply humiliated by this ordeal as an unknown man had to give me his shirt so I could continue shopping as I needed my banking pin for the transaction and no one saw a problem with him undressing in the store, or the Covid times we are living in. I have full footage of the ordeal.It is truly saddening that women cannot express themselves even though I make my own clothes, I have to wear my clothes to promote my business so I can be able to shop at Shoprite that is the only way I make money, this hurts as I recently went to Johannesburg; Braamfontein where I was dressed in the same outfit and I got purchase orders for the same outfit where people had a positive response to it not this dark cloud of hate that was surrounding me at your store.In closing I would like to let you know that I will be seeking legal guidance from a family lawyer and we will see how they advise me to continue with this matter.

poor service from ShopRiteI am writing this complaint to you  because of the poor service I experienced at ShopRite Katlehong Gamaphuteng shopping center, I've got 2 incidence that I'd like to report that occurred  in a short space of time.1)26/11/2021  from what we know    Shoprite is closing at 20:00pm to my surprise when I got there it was closed at around 19:00 pm  .on the door there was no notification to advise us about the situation  instead we  were arrogantly told  that the store decided to close at around 19:00pm due to severe  rain storm,  my issue with this store they  DON'T CARE.  they are supposed to advise us/ put a notification.  ShopRite Gamaphuteng did not do that  personally I feel  this particular store has the worsted service and they don't to follow correct process and procedures  as per consumer act2)To add on the above on 04/01/2022 my mother went to the store again to withdraw her pension SASSA, she was treated so bad  by the cashiers, she  was running around like a headless chicken, as usual she was sent from pillar to post due to the fact that the store did not have funds. from my understanding the government subsidies the business to render the service (grants) but at Gamaphuteng we struggle it's like we have to be at their mercy for the service we deserve.  I decided to go  to the store   as I was "gatvol" of the service we've been getting as the community, for heaven sake my mother is old. The manager on duty that day was so arrogant and did not want to assist us  with anything  her attitude was  so condescending,I believe Checkers/ Shoprite is contributing a lot towards the economy of SA however the service we are receiving daily does not show.can this matter please be addressed,  personally I think my family and myself deserves an apology/ compensation  from Shoprite Gamaphuteng

Case Title: Manager rude to Cashier in store
Case Description: Customer was shopping in the store this morning, 15.01 just past 8am. At the till about to pay for his items.  A Male Manager approached the Cashier, Phumeza Mfingwana, saying she must not sit down and stand while helping the customer.  The cashier asked why she cannot sit down and even complained that the Manager keeps telling her to keep standing.  The Manager even told the Cashier that if she is not happy she can resign. Cashier seemed very upset.  I assured him that we have formal processes in place for employees to report grievances so that a full review can take place of their concerns. As a business we want all staff to be treated with respect and dignity and will address any instance where this is not the case.  Also advised that we can't share details of employee matters with third parties.I advised him that this will be reported to the Regional Personnel Manager who attends to staff matters to investigate and action.  He is happy with our response

Message: Good dayPlease be as kind as to retrainthe manager at this store. Costomer care to the manager, Humphrey means sitting in his office. It seems as if the external security officer knows more of what is happening in the store than him.There seem to be no responsability towards effecient customer flow, as there is NEVER more than 1 cashier onduty at the check out. The line of frustrated customers end up being up to 10 people long, wich creates an unHEALTHY, unsavoury shopping experience.I visit the shop out of absolute need to, not want to. Yesterday I entered the shop, once again out of need, going to the money counter. As I entered, there were no clients at the counter. The cashier, upon seeing and aknowledging me, then proceeded to lift his cash tray and disappear into the non- managers office "to count his money", ignoring me at the counter. At the single till point, 11 aggitated customers were being served by 1 rather unenthusiastic casier. After waiting several minutes, the security officer advised me to rather join the line of people and withdraw cash at the till.I wanted to see the manager at this point...but alas, as usual, no response.I cued, without social distancing being enforced by anyone, and waited and waited. After nearly 5 minutes, Humphrey emerged from his office clutching his cell phone.He did not pay any atyention to the problem, nor aknowledge that there is one.Not even when eventually, I had a chance to reach the cashier, only to be told that he doesn't have the correct money in his drawer for my withdrawel.By this time Humphrey, still clutching his phone, has disappeared back into his office, leaving the cashier to handle a bunch of neglected and frustrated customers. And still, there was not a soul in sight at the money market...If this was a once off occurance, I would not be investing my time to complain. This is unfortunately the umpteenth time.Furtermore, is there a standard setting prescribed to your shops for the aircon? This shop runs on anything between 25- 30 degrees daily. This results in aggitated clients and wilted (un)fresh produce.It is no use to put a new coat of paint onto a long broken item. Although I understand the concept of no big prices, no big marketing so Usave, I do firmly believe that customer satisfaction and care should be of highest priority in ANY circumstance.Awaiting your improvements.RegardsW. She was taken out of the store, and her mother was dragged out of the store. She is not happy with how her mother was treated because she was the one fighting, not her mother. She says she has constantly seen how the security allows customers with no masks into the store and have addressed it with them but they continue. The management team does not enforce social distancing, and this has now led to customers fighting physically. She says that if a manager stepped in, this would have prevented everything from escalating. GreetingsResidents of Bertrams JHB would like to know why the specials pamphlets of Shoprite & Checkers / Checkers Hyper always get delivered a few days before the end date.Most of the time we receive them Tuesday / Wednesday when the end date is Sunday of the same week. Specials run for two consecutive weeks ?Imagine the disappointment receiving the current pamphlets three days ago on Wednesday, not only that the end date is this Sunday but also that the current specials began 03/01/2022 ...Your two assigned field workers are doing a remarkable job delivering pamphlets, but the one who sends them to do deliveries for Bertrams is contributing to your retail loss by not sending them when the specials start. Please bear in mind that only a few employed residents have access to your WhatsApp store leaflets. We have many unemployed residents, among them disabled breadwinners unable to find any sort of gainful employment.The long & short of your constant drop in sales under these strained economic times is retrenchment. Please help us to help you avoid such predicament.Your store shelves are always fully stocked, friendly in-store staff and we have our xtra savings cards to prove our loyalty; but without your pamphlet communication arriving on time even your cleaning & call centre staff's effort will be in vain. All of you have families to feed, as well.We thank you for tending to our query.tay subbanon behalf of Bertrams residents

Case Title: Xtra Savings - Deals not as advertised
Case Description: HiI have experienced this price discrepancy many times at your Attlyn malls' branch. I have had refunds done many times and I am now sick and tired of the same problem time after time.You Shoprite, publish your specials ad catalogues on the web monthly and weekly for us to access and we go to the nearest store but only to find what you advertised is not the price at the store. Why?? I always check whether the special price is applicable to gauteng stores before I go shopping but not all items will be at my branch. For e.g. this month/week's specials :Listerine is not R33 as advert shows but R39 (didnt buy)Eggs Ritebrand 30x not R55 but R63 (settled for 18x pack at R38)1L Ygt(fruits of forest/clover classic) not R24 but R33/R38Parmalat Ygt x6x 2 not R28 but normal price each (my till slip is proof and I swiped my XSavings card).Plus they didn't have the special prize on shelf on the fridge. This happens most times with popular items such as yoghurt esp now that schools are open.I know sometimes the prices advertised may only be for items at the  Shoprite Plaza branch but not this time.So can someone explain why????Is this a franchise issue???? Or a demand or stock levels issue??? Or a greed issue??? Or incompetence issue??? Or exploitation of blacks as in the old RSA.???I thought Shoprite was dedicated to help citizens esp poor and unemployed  ones in these tough economic times to access groceries, toiletries, ie basic necessities??Unhappy XSavings Customer????????Ponjo0829315890/0637961495PS: I do appreciate the price lockdown on most essential foods!!

The customer called toa dvised that she never received her voucher as yet, I advised her of these steps, she must still get her voucher from the dept of health, she can confirm with them as the campaign ended Dec 2021 or until there are no more vouchers. : Thought to share as FYI so we have an understanding on how this process worksAfter the eligible person has gone for the vaccine, during the campaign period, they will receive an SMS from DOH (Department of Health) to state they qualify for the R200 Vooma voucher. They then need to send the word YES to 44040 to get their voucher. That is the opt in step for the voucher Once they send this free SMS the voucher will go to the same number that they sent the SMS from.Once the customer receives the SMS with the voucher they need to use that same cell phone number to go to *120*3534# (MMA) to redeem the voucherIf the cell phone number is not the same the customer needs to phone MMA to assist.

Case Title: Class of 2022 Competition - How to enter
Case Description: Hi there I would an opportunity to enter the competition in school fees please advice

I have a suggestion though.Most of shoprite branches are in the townships and mostly and about 90% of schools are public schools whereby the school fees are mostly less than R5000.00 a year as compared to private/ suburban schools where the fees are normally  more than R5000.00 a year.I know the competition is open to everyone and I am not saying that only township learners should be chosen.Lets say for example you choose a learner from the township and fees are(R1500) yearly and suburbs fees (R18000)yearly.To the tomnship school you will pay only R1500 leaving you with the saving of R3500 and  surburbs school you pay the full amount R5000.Seeing this two scenarios,my suggestion is why not where the fees are less than R5000,the difference amount should be utilesed like in the form of a voucher to purchase uniforms,stationery and all other support material for the learner.We all know now the cost of stationery,uniforms,textbooks,etc is very high and I am sure  the money will come in handy to both the learner and parents.

Hello,My name is Fernando Nieves and I have been working in olive oil for more than 30 years.Due to security problems I had to emigrate from South America to Spain, we chose it with my family because it is the largest producer of olive oil in the world and I plan to continue my work from here.Today I am writing to you because I need your help, I am starting from scratch and it is not easy at all.Surely at some point in the year you will need olive oil. I offer you absolute fidelity, as well as, of course, an extra virgin olive oil of the highest possible quality and a modern and original image.Do not look for a cheap oil in me, please do not confuse me, I am offering a 100% genuine oil, so if you are looking for the cheapest oil on the market, do not call me because I cannot reach those prices, but if you are looking for trust, compliance, modern design and top quality, write me that we will reach a good agreement and be good business partners and of course, I will never forget the hand you gave me in the hard time of restarting.I trust you will give me the opportunity to try the oil and I assure you that I will not disappoint you!SincerelyFernando Nieves

The customer called to find out where her Vooma voucher. I explained the following to her.The customer only has one dose of pfizer and is not yet fully vaccinated.After the eligible person has gone for the vaccine, during the campaign period, they will receive an SMS from DOH (Department of Health) to state they qualify for the R200 Vooma voucher. They then need to send the word YES to 44040 to get their voucher. That is the opt in step for the voucher Once they send this free SMS the voucher will go to the same number that they sent the SMS from.Once the customer receives the SMS with the voucher they need to use that same cell phone number to go to *120*3534# (MMA) to redeem the voucher
